Reviews.Title: “A true W Montreal!”
Reviews.Author: MrEzDesign
Reviews.Content: This hotel is great and modern! Check in and out was fast and easy, valet parking being only one option to take for $35 a day and your car is taken care of. Getting car in and out is fast and easy, no complaints. Room is quite modern, everything is detailed and professionally done. Very clean, very spacious along with open concept bathroom viewing to the room, one of unique feature found at W Montreal. Friendly atmosphere, lots of young people and entertainment going on nightly on 2nd floor. Overall great experience and definitely would be back! Thanks for the great stay, W Montreal!

Reviews.Title: “Simply incredible stay. Great room, staff, and experience!”
Reviews.Author: mibbs2004
Reviews.Content: We experienced an unexpected layover in Montreal en route to Paris and didn't want to stay at the airport hotels so got a room at the W. From start to finish this W property was fantastic! Check in took about 1 minute and the front desk agent asked if we were hungry and needed reservations at a restaurant. We did and she immediately called herself to a restaurant we knew of, and managed to convince them to take us at that late hour. The room was spectacular. Very well designed and VERY large, with a beautiful walk in shower, oversized and separate tub, and a great view of Montreal. I have to say that even the shampoo / soap / conditioner and lotion were above par (I actually took them with us!). We couldn't have been happier with it. We managed to also get a fairly decent rate because the hotel wasn't full that night. Much cheaper than some of the other "lesser" properties. The doorman was quick to get us a cab, we went to eat, came back and were immediately told that we could get line bypass to go to the bar for a nightcap. The bar is a hotspot in Montreal and was very crowded but we still managed to get some seating and talked to a few people. Definitely a younger crowd (and attractive) so be forewarned. Music was good and the people were friendly. I don't know why people complain on these reviews about guest being loud in neighbouring rooms, or that the bar was crowded. How is that the hotel's fault?! And who wants a bar that's dead? Our hall was dead quiet and we couldn't hear any street noise at all. The served us up a delcious breakfast in the room, very well laid out (you feel a little bit like a rock star there!) and we were off. They also have a VERY late check out (4 PM) which was great because we didn't have to be back at the airport until early evening. Overall, the entire experience was extremely enjoyable.

Reviews.Title: “Great place !”
Reviews.Author: EricVanNguyen
Reviews.Content: Went there a few times and love the place ! Great music and great staff! It's the perfect place to hang out before going out! Worth every penny in my opinion! Cheers, Eric Van Nguyen

Reviews.Title: “Unfortunate experience because of noisy guests”
Reviews.Author: Nathalie D
Reviews.Content: Stayed here only one night and unfortunately did not get much sleep, because the guests in next room decided to have a party at 3:30 AM. Called the front desk and they sent up security to ask them to turn off the music. Unfortunately the noise continued on and off for another hour or so (loud talking, doors slamming) which prevented us from sleeping. Had to call reception another two times to complain and the hotel offered to move us to another room at 5AM. The next morning we were told that as the room had already been paid for, they could not offer us anything as compensation. The hotel is well located in downtown Montreal, in front of a metro station. Rooms are nice but small and many of them face indoors (ours had a view of the offices next door). There is a minibar but wifi is not free, neither is breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “It's all about the location and size that matters”
Reviews.Author: Faumun
Reviews.Content: Location location location. Sitting just at the edge of Old Montreal, the business district, the Port of Montreal and Chinatown, this is my FAVE hotel in the city. The rooms are modern, and without exagerating HUMUNGOUS. The staff are W classy, and the concierge Mireille is non other than the best there is. The only reason I gave this a 4 instead of a 5, is that at the street level of the hotel there is a club that is extremely "loud" on the weekend, starting Thursday's. But to be fair, the hotel did react to my complaints. A must stay for me, and my only HOTEL of choice while in Montreal.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel & Great Service!”
Reviews.Author: gypsy604
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the W on points as we were on our way to our honeymoon but didn't want to take a red eye flight. Unfortunately our flight getting to Montreal was 5 hours delayed so by the time we arrived at the W, it was late and we were quite tired. I let the check in staff know this and he kindly upgraded us to a beautiful, huge, stylish room which really made a difference. We managed to have a drink at the bar before we retired and were impressed by the decor and style but the prices of the drinks were pretty expensive as was the room service we ended up ordering. For a total of two drinks (one wine, one soda) at the bar and two bagels with jam from room service, our total bill came out to $56 which I think was very ridiculous. This would be my only complaint!

Reviews.Title: “W Montreal Amazing”
Reviews.Author: russmuscle
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the W in Montreal and had an amazing time. The suite was huge and the bathroom was incredible. We were greeted by friendly staff who entertained out desperate attempts at speaking French. Everyone was polite and so helpful. The room was simply posh and beautiful. The bed was huge and had a pillow top mattress and filled with soft comforters and pillows. The room had every amenity you could think of from headphone jacks for I phone players to a completely stocked bar and snack area. The bathroom was huge and had a big shower head and a water fall tub. My only suggestion would be more shower heads in the shower for fun. Over all, our stay was terrific and the bars and resteraunts were excellent! Would definitely go back!

Reviews.Title: “Misleading High Rating on Tripadvisor”
Reviews.Author: jokemaker323
Reviews.Content: There were basically two main issues for me with my stay. The first was the feeling of cheapness in this hotel. $35 for parking, $20 to buy a movie on the TV, a bottle of water for $5, and $20 for internet are all absurd. There is nothing worse for me than a hotel I feel is trying to nickel and dime me (with twenties) around every corner. It was blatantly obvious it was designed for corporate customers who aren't travelling for themselves and could care less. The internet thing is just absurd and the broadband wasn't even free. It's a rather dated and weak way to try to raise money. Luckily, we were offered a special! from the hotel upon check-in for cocktails (sounded nice). The coupons offered us two cocktails at the dramatically reduced price of $12 a drink marked down from $15. Not really an exciting promotion upon entering the hotel. Now on to the room. The decor is more of a personal taste thing. It isn't classy but it could be 'fun' depending on what you are looking for and I won't judge that for you. What was insane to me was the lighting. It was the worst lit hotel room I have ever seen and I am not exaggerating. Aside from there being no real windows (a view of other windows a meter or two away), the lighting in the room looked like prison lights and only lit corners of the room (no overhead light). I've never really paid attention to lighting in any hotel I have ever stayed in so this was something special. It was rather dreary (although did lead to sleeping until 11 in a comfortable bed!). The service was nice but it was amazing how bureaucratic it is within the W chain. We wanted something we saw online and the front desk basically said they can't offer it but if we go online and ask for it that way, we can get it. Without a computer this was a hassle. A really awkward and trivial ring to have to jump through but it is what it is. If you are looking for a big corporate hotel and want a change from your usual, this could still be your option. If you are looking for a truly fun hotel, a good value, and/or a great overall room, I'd look elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Trendy but NOT a good business hotel”
Reviews.Author: SKim78
Reviews.Content: This was my first and last time staying here for business. If you're a young couple on a vacation looking for something unique, then this is the hotel for you. Likes: - Really comfortable beds - Ultra modern decor with some added touches - Bliss bath products (they even provide a nice face wash) Dislikes: - No coffee maker in room (they suggest you should go downstairs and enjoy free coffee in the lounge). Personally, I like my cuppa in the morning while sorting through emails - Prohibitively expensive room service (and it wasn't all that great) - Lighting while funky never quite gives off enough light - My room was so close to the office building beside me that you could see in their windows and vice versa so I had to have my curtains closed the whole stay

Reviews.Title: “Classy boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: Bonjours
Reviews.Content: This is very good boutique hotel with comfortable rooms and beds, great showers and a fine restaurant. Reception, service and valet was superlative. Unfortunately you feel nickeled and dimes with extra charges for every thing. WIFI in the room is $20 per 24 hour (not free which is now the standard), you must use valet parking at $35 per day (public parking available several blocks away).

Reviews.Title: “Perfect”
Reviews.Author: ABE116
Reviews.Content: Two weeks ago, my husband and I stayed at the W Montreal for one night. Every detail was perfect and I wanted to share our positive experience with other travellers. Everyone who worked at the W---from the valet service (with the bottled water), the bartenders, the front desk, and the concierge were professional and made us feel special. We enjoyed meeting Mary, who cleans the rooms on the 8th floor, who was friendly, polite, helpful, and of course, made sure our room was exceptionally clean and stocked with our favourite Bliss products.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Stay!”
Reviews.Author: ETrussler
Reviews.Content: We spent 7 nights at the W and it was wonderful. Couldn't have asked for better stay. The hotel was beautiful and the service was impeccable. The rooms are amazing and very comfortable. Anything we needed was handled by the WHATEVER/WHENEVER desk and it was handled quickly. Definitely a place to stay whether you are staying a night or a week.

Reviews.Title: “Chic hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: JandK786
Reviews.Content: We spent 1 night at his hotel in winter for a romantic getaway. The hotel is very chic, as one would expect from a W hotel. The lobby is warm and colourful with cozy lighting. There's an excellent restaurant attached to the lobby which is part of the hotel, called "Otto", excellent food and surprisingly reasonable in pricing. The staff was very friendly and helpful. We stayed in a "Cozy room", with a view overlooking Victoria Square ... fantastic! And you also have a nice view of the Montreal skyline, which is rare. Great view and an excellent room: very roomy, also with cozy blue lighting, super comfortable bed, and best of all, a rain shower (and this is a real rain shower!). The location of his hotel is great, especially if you want to explore Old Montreal. You're on the outskirts of Old Montreal, and a short-walk away from the downtown core, so it's the best of both worlds. If you walk 2-3 minutes south, you get to the corner of McGill and St. Jacques, which faces Square Victoria metro. From here you can either walk down St. Jacques to Place d'Armes and get right into the heart of Old Montreal (Place d'Armes Square, Notre Dame Cathedral), or you can head straight down McGill street, with its great restaurants, and go straight to the waterfront (de la Commune). OR, you can decide to get into the metro station, explore the underground city and hop on the metro. We loved our experience at this hotel and would definitely go back.

Reviews.Title: “Romantic getaway”
Reviews.Author: Katie M
Reviews.Content: This hotel is amazing, from its modern chic decor to the friendly service. Me and my husband enjoyed every moment that we were at the W hotel. Its nice and close to all the nice restaurants and lounges, as well as shopping! I would recommend this hotel to any couple who is looking for a nice atmosphere.

Reviews.Title: “Winter escape”
Reviews.Author: cmello28
Reviews.Content: Thia was my first time in Montreal I used my Starwood points to stay at the W. overall very hip and trendy. Not a big property on a busy st. We opted to park our car In a lot across the st which is cheaper. Walking distance to old Montreal not bad overall walkin distance to most places. Room is nice we had wonderful room with the open shower pretty fun for a couple . Bed very comfy. Free coffee and wifi in lobby. Concierge gave good suggestions. Overall decent staying with points wouldn't pay full price!

Reviews.Title: “Pricey Boutique Hotel with Pizzazz”
Reviews.Author: IanGadbois
Reviews.Content: W is a small chain of boutique hotels owned by Starwoods (Sheraton, Westin, etc). The Montreal location is across from Victoria Square close to the Old Port and Old Montreal. Our greeting by the valet was warm and friendly, but the receptionist seemed disinterested and did not continue the charm. The hotel has a youthful, edgy vibe to it and attracts a younger, partying crowd (albeit with money). There is a variety of room sizes and configurations in this converted office building. Our room had no tub, but a large shower room with a glass wall opening directly on the bedroom. Not everyone will enjoy this style of showering. Our daughter's room had a massive soaker tub that took the better part of an hour to fill. Rooms, hallways and common areas are bathed in a moody blue light. Rooms and elevators could be more brightly lit. The "Whatever, Whenever" service is very cool in that they will facilitate just about anything that is legal. A nice touch is the complimentary Acura driving service to take you anywhere in the City. A well-equipped exercise room, but no pool. The king-size bed was very comfortable, but was shorter than a regulation-size king. I'm 6'1" and my feet were at the end of the bed. Sound-proofing was better than average, but not the best. Very little noise from neighbours, plumbing or the hallway, but we could hear the outside street noise.

Reviews.Title: “W Montreal”
Reviews.Author: J T
Reviews.Content: I needed a room last minute and the front desk staff was very helpful and attentive. Also, the conceirge was very knowledgeable of the area and gave me some good recommendations. They also offer an Acura to take you to your destination so you don't have to wait for a cab. The room was decorated beautifully and the bed and linens were extremely comfortable. Room service was under a half hour on a busy Sunday morning and the food was wonderful!!

Reviews.Title: “excellent service and room”
Reviews.Author: LondonFamilia
Reviews.Content: here for 3 weeks i did the crystal hotel and Westin after my weekend at the W decided to stay there for the last week positive: excellent personalised service ,Catherine at reception was so helpful and enthusiastic that i booked 5 more days the doorman every day greeted me people smiling love that hotel!! room service fast with very good service good gym love my room but it was a mega size room facing the park negative: they should provide a coffee machine although they serve coffee in the hall in the morning you don't want to get dress to go downstair for a free coffee or pay like I did $17 for coffee room service negative a bit noisy at weekend i think that the rooms are not so feel insulated i will come back my overall experience was fantastic p.s don't go to their Otto restaurant overpriced bad service and food average you could find so much better in Montreal because Montreal is such a gourmet city

Reviews.Title: “Impressed”
Reviews.Author: SusanM643
Reviews.Content: i stayed at the W for the first time for a business trip. I knew to expect fairly good quality given that its a Starwood chain but I wasn't expecting the 'cool' factor at this hotel. The lobby and room is quite trendy. The hotel room was spacious and well laid out - only a clear glass wall separated the shower from the bed area - first I have ever experienced. Nice amenity kit from bliss labs. Service was excellent throughout the hotel. Will definately go back there.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel and Service”
Reviews.Author: pololuca
Reviews.Content: I just love this hotel and this chain. The service is just over the tops and I am always super confy there. We also take the Wonderful room. The food is also quite good. I tried the spa service this time and it was very good. This hotel never dissapoints...

Reviews.Title: “Incredible decor, classic W accommodations.”
Reviews.Author: happyfamily570
Reviews.Content: My family were thoroughly impressed with this hotel. It is so fun and different. The rooms were enormous and very luxurious with great touches such as comfy chairs and throws. The bathroom though equally beautiful was slightly strange in that it had no door but rather a curtain which resembled a hospital curtain. This unattractive curtain also left no privacy as it was see-through. The bathrooms otherwise gorgeous and enormous. Everything is incredibly modern and hip. Though we enjoyed our stay we were very dismayed to have been disturbed by security. They rudely came to our room at 10pm to tell us that there had been several complaints about how noisy we were being. We were shocked as all we were doing is talking to each other. It made more sense when we heard our neighbors' on both sides, televisions and conversations throughout the night. To say that the walls were thin is to put it mildly. Nonetheless we did enjoy our stay, had we been there for more than a night we might have discussed this with the staff.

Reviews.Title: “Trendy hotel, maybe too much...”
Reviews.Author: arivest
Reviews.Content: W Montreal is a trendy hotel very much in the style of all W hotels. Lobby and halways are dark and you do get the feeling of being in a club. Staff are friendly. Our check -in was easy and quick and we were upgraded to a larger room (Starwood Platinum member). The room we were given was indeed fairly large, on an upper level with a nice view on the park. The room is clean and well appointed and still looks rather new. The gym is on a lower floor and a bit small. Main problem with the hotel is the constant noise. The staff or the hotel is not too blame but other residents are. We have stayed there four three nights so far and it is always the same; people come back to their rooms in the middle of the night and talk loudly in the hallways. We have asked for quiet rooms in the past but have always had the same problem. I will be reluctant to stay again on a week-end, unless of course I plan on going out all night. Other thing is the location which is so-so. It is a bit in a no mans land between Old Montreal and downtown, up the hill. For some, it can be a plus since it is relatively easy to walk anywhere. Altogether a very good hotel and comfortable place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Romantic, fabulous, "sweet" suite”
Reviews.Author: n0rthsh0regal
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend took me to the W for a romantic, night away. It was all we could have wanted! The luxurious suite he booked was spacious, well decorated, and just what we needed. The large windows, EXTRA large tub and shower, and funky furniture were all fabulous touches! We did not visit any of the bars or restaurants in the hotel during our stay, but were quite impressed with the customer service at the desk and overall ambiance. Can't wait to stay at the W again!

Reviews.Title: “The perfect hotel for the perfect city”
Reviews.Author: thelivingjuj
Reviews.Content: The only thing I can think to say about this hotel is "How soon can I go back?" I have never had a nicer stay, period. I would echo what other reviewers have said, that if you need a really quiet room, just ask - ours was elegant, delightful, and silent. I would like to give a special shout-out to the concierge and front desk since I was traveling with two kids (albeit well-traveled ones), which is not very W. The concierge recommended two perfect restaurants for us without missing a beat. Triple-perfect location for exploring the City without being right on Rue St. Catherine (shudder). Highly recommended. Eat beans & rice for a month prior to afford to stay here if necessary.

Reviews.Title: “Nice but small”
Reviews.Author: Isabel39_10
Reviews.Content: The rooms are very nice but small. very trendy, good location, nice decor, very nice shower but again the rooms are so small.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing property in Montreal!”
Reviews.Author: Y M
Reviews.Content: Highly recommend this hotel. Brand new, clean, first class services!

Reviews.Title: “Winter Escape at the W”
Reviews.Author: Justin B
Reviews.Content: When I decided to head up to Montreal for a long weekend in January with my boyfriend, I couldn't help but stay at the W! I have been to a few W locations around the country previously, but this one was definitely one of my favorites! Upon our arrival we were greeted by an extremely helpful and friendly staff who were able to help us with our luggage and check us in quickly! We stayed in a wonderful room and it was absolutely incredible! The king bed was so comfortable, the bathroom was so clean and everything about the room was just incredibly designed. I know a lot of people have complained about the noise at the W but honestly, I didn't hear a thing. I just got back from a trip in San Diego where I stayed at one of the Starwood Luxury Collection hotels and I must say it was much louder there, so the noise at the W was definitely not a problem! During our stay we took advantage of the Acura service which was perfect, especially since it was sooo cold and coming from the DC area, I was not used to the freezing temperatures. Speaking of the cold, another great feature about the W is the underground metro access right from the hotel. This is very convenient when you aren't ready to face the cold but want to venture out of your wonderful bed at the W. I cannot wait to come back to the W this spring during my spring break from college, because 3 nights here was just not enough!!!!! I love the W and they continue to impress every time I stay there! One tip though: Parking with the W is around $35 for every 20 hours, which is a little bit ridiculous. So if you don't mind parking your own car instead of using valet, you can park right across the street. (which is actually the same garage that the W uses to keep your car) for like $17 a night or something like that. So just keep that in mind if you want to save a little bit of money!

Reviews.Title: “Friendly staff, great decor, and good location”
Reviews.Author: pouladi
Reviews.Content: Good location in old Montreal, close to the Old Port and many other tourist attractions. The Square Victoria metro is right across from the hotel, a short 1-minute walk away. The room was spacious with modern and tasteful decor. The bed was clean very comfortable. The washroom was also a good size, but with a walk-in shower (no bathtub). One peculiarity is that there were no curtains to cover the walk in shower, which is only separated by a tinted glass wall from bedroom. So perhaps good for couples, but not so ideal for someone looking for some privacy while showering. The hotel itself has a bar (wunderbar) and lounge area on the second floor. Good ambience and ideal if you want to have a "night out" without actually having to leave the hotel. However, the bar/lounge may cause the occasional problem on Friday/Satuday nights, as party goers staying at the hotel & shuttling between the lounges and their rooms may yell loudly and slam doors, forgetting that there are guests at the hotel who may be sleeping at 3am in morning. This happened to us, and we were woken up a couple of times by some unusually energetic guests who also seemed to be running back and forth in the hallway. In any case, the beds were so comfortable that we easily fell back to sleep. Overall, a good hotel in a great location, but beware of Friday/Saturday nights. Tip: You can take the 747 Express bus from the airport to within a 5-min walk from the hotel. The ride takes about 45 minutes, and the stop closest to the hotel is "Union street" (stop #6). Follow the signs to Square Victoria and hotel will just a short walk downhill. The bus fare is $8, but keep in mind that you can pay with COINS only. The ticket you get includes a 24 hour pass that can be used for buses and the metro.

Reviews.Title: “Cool W, Cool City”
Reviews.Author: Matt O
Reviews.Content: Sadly only got to stay one night at this place - but it is everything that W is about. Montreal is a great place and I intend to return to both places asap, to explore further

Reviews.Title: “Here on business - very very good experience”
Reviews.Author: photoshoot_producer
Reviews.Content: I stay in a lot of hotels internationally, travelling with crews for photo shoots. The service here has been AMAZING. The staff are fantastic, the beds, sheets and pillows are superb and the bathtubs are huge. The gym is really really really good - new high end machines with all the bells and whistles, all of us are very impressed. The room service is limited and pretty expensive, but very high quality.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place but a bit to hip”
Reviews.Author: bennyscuba
Reviews.Content: Was here for 4 nights for a conference. Maybe i'm getting old but hotels like this and hard rock hotels just don't do it for me. You walk in and it feels like a night club - the lobby is dark the music is playing. You just got off a long flight and all you want to do is relax - this isn't really the place. The rooms while very nice, are also dark and somewhat impractical. I can't dock too much, b/c the bed is obviously comfortable, the staff is friendly and helpful, there were no major issues, and the breakfast while pricey was very good. It real comes down to taste and maybe i'm just getting old...

Reviews.Title: “under par performance - beware your minibar charges!!”
Reviews.Author: Sveenz
Reviews.Content: I stayed at W Hotel Montreal already in January 2011 and voiced a couple of complaints to management, such as unfriendly service, disturbance by housekeeping on several occasions, noise from other guests throughout all night Friday and Saturday, hassle to get access to night-club even being a hotel guest, mistakes in invoice and ridiculous minibar after charges. Instead of putting my comments directly on Tripadvisor I wrote a letter to the management to give them a chance to make things better since I know that glitches sometimes happen as a natural human thing. But I should be proven wrong. As a service recovery I was invited again to stay at on of their suites. The room was very nice indeed; very modern design but still comfortable. The concierge service with Daniel is excellent, his advice is very good. But thats about it. Service in other areas is poor and from the entire proclaimed "WOW" experience I did not feel anything. Even though I stayed as "difficult guest" I was surprised how many of the same things went wrong again. I was not assisted by the door man on arrival, had to wait 20min to check in and other minor things. But I was especially disturbed by another mini-bar after charge on my credit card statement of roughly CAD100 although I never use the mini-bar anywhere. Thus, W Hotel Montreal is an average hotel and does not live up to its standards. And beware of your minibar charges, some processes in that department are very much going wrong there.

Reviews.Title: “Great Staff and Good Location”
Reviews.Author: PECCruiser
Reviews.Content: Went to Montreal for four days and had a great stay at the W. Max(the concierge) was amazing in helping us with restaurant reservations as well as getting around the city. The hotel is located adjacent to old Montreal and walking distance to everything. The lounge had a great atmosphere and the little library area on the MZ level was a greaet nook to hook up to the wifi to check emails and go online for free.

Reviews.Title: “What makes the W Montreal is the staff!!!!! :)))”
Reviews.Author: Tbillings28
Reviews.Content: I travel quite often and have become a Platinum SPG member of the Starwood group of hotels. There is only 1 hotel that I choose to stay in while in Montreal and it is the W! Everyone from Dorine, Patrick and the extended team makes me feel at home. Whether traveling alone on business or with my family, this is one of my favorite hotels in North America. Thanks to the W Montreal team. They even found me cufflinks at the last minute when I forgot them at home!!! Love you guys!

Reviews.Title: “Style over substance, very mediocre hotel”
Reviews.Author: dh88888888
Reviews.Content: This is a hotel that's mainly style over substance, wanna-be over service. It's really not worth your time and money given that there's many other great hotels within less than 5 minutes walking distance. This review is based on a 4 night stay. 1) Let's face it, for the money this hotel charges you can stay at 5 star hotels, this hotel is 4 stars, but I have no idea how they managed to get that. The rooms are below average (think frat boy meets ikea), some rooms have no windows with natural light and the service is mediocre at best. 2) I was aware it was going to be noisy on the weekends due to the "club", but even on floors 6, 7 one can feel the bass and hear all the music (btw, get a new "DJ" 'cos the music was just terrible). I initially thought people were whining about the noise, but it IS really bad (and terrible music too; no skills). 3) Service? What service? As soon as you arrive they ask if you want 1K points instead of having them clean the room every day. I generally don't want them to clean the room every single day, but I do need towels, etc. so that sounded like a good compromise. Getting towels, etc. was a bit tricky though since nobody is EVER at the concierge area. I had to call back 3 times to get a person on the phone. I thought this place had staff on site 24x7? Leaving messages wasn't useful 'cos the times I did they never bothered to listen to it but just called back (then why have voice mail?). 4) Everything is terribly over priced, nothing is included and (again, emphasizing) service is poor. I have no problem paying $30 for breakfast, but I do expect the food and service to be great. Here I am waiting for someone to take our order and I can see our waiter is busy texting on their iphone. Really? Every time I was waiting for something, I could see him text. (I mean, at least go somewhere that I can't see it; I would have assumed you were busy handling the 2 other tables; yes, there was 5 staff, 3 tables used; yet, it was near impossible to get our server's attention). I do apologize if I was wrong, perhaps he was playing angry birds instead of texting. 5) The only great thing was that they were able to get some decent champagne sent up on new years eve; we arrived late after the regular stores closed. In summary: style over substance, mediocre hotel with low class service. Would not recommend this place to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Funky, Hip Starwood Property!”
Reviews.Author: emmadays
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the W Montreal twice, both times being New Years Eve. The lobby is welcoming with oversized couches and fuzzy pillows, and the front desk staff is helpful and accommodating. This past time we stayed in the Mega Room, and was impressed with the size and enjoyed the minimalist decor. Bed was comfortable, and bathroom was cool but provided little privacy. We had a blast on New Years Eve partying at Wunderbar, which I believed to be the best party in the city that night. The "beautiful people" definitely stay at this hotel, people who clearly have good taste, fashion, and enjoy the finer things in life.The location is OK, for I would prefer to be closer to St. Laurent and/or St. Catherine's St. I would NOT recommend staying here with kids or a family. The rooms are not kid friendly and the clientele is more couples and groups, 25+ or so. Plan to stay here again upon my next visit to Montreal in April!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice and super trendy”
Reviews.Author: mikeyp626
Reviews.Content: This property embodies all that the "W" hotel is. Super trendy and very clean. Just a little background on myself, I lived in Manhattan for 5+ years and now live in the Back Bay area in Boston. We tend to enjoy some of the finer things in life, and will almost always stay at a 4+ star hotel when traveling. I was very impressed and the wife was very happy with the accomodations. The location was OK - near Old Montreal, and walkable to all the major attractions in the city. The lobby was very cool and encapsulates a very lively environment as there is a bar area connected to the open lobby space. The room was dimly lit and had dark furniture that could be IKEA quality but it just worked in terms over overall ambience. The bed was comfortable, and they did a great job designing the room. I can't say its the nicest hotel I've stayed at, but I was very impressed with the overall experience.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice W Property”
Reviews.Author: jmudukes79
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for a night the first week in July before heading to Toronto for the Phillies/Blue Jays series, the Montreal Jazz Festival was in town and the W is located in close enough proximity to the main drag and downtown area that walking was not an issue at all. Stayed in one of the multi-level suites on the top floor, very nice layout, solid view from the deck. Staff was very professional at check-in. They also helped me with a special event they were having that night, John Legend ended up performing a few songs in the lounge and the hotel helped me coordinate leaving some extra tickets for friends who would arrive later. All in all was a very solid experience.

Reviews.Title: “A disappointment for a W Hotel”
Reviews.Author: MarikaFrumes
Reviews.Content: I am an avid traveler for business/ pleasure and spend at least one week of the month away from home. Further, I work in the hotel industry at a NYC hotel. I mention this as hoteliers often have more patience/ understanding when things don't work out as planned and it takes A LOT for me to write a negative review. My boyfriend, who was with me this past weekend at the W is also a Starwood Gold member, he too has been loyal to the brand and travels frequently. In my travels I have become a fan of the W's and have frequented many of the properties. The W Montreal unfortunately misses the consistency mark, typically exemplified by W, by a LONG shot and as it is now, should be a hot button for the Starwood brand. There's too much to list about my negative experience here this past weekend. I will just lay out the basics: 1. Arrival to the hotel to a raging party on the 10th floor. We arrived past 12am and this party continued to 3:30am- sleep was not an option as you could hear everything happening outside the room. There was a security guard on the floor who was a W employee and was fully aware of the event. (which didn't prevent him from stopping it) 2. The "window" in our "wonderful" room was tiny and the room felt like a jail cell. *I understand that the W can't do anything to address this issue but I thought it was important to point out for potential guests who want a view. 3. Breakfast came incomplete without toast and tea and boasted a price point of $120 for 2 people. The hotel was very generous to provide us with a complimentary breakfast for the troubles with noise however this service recovery turned into further frustration once the breakfast order came up incomplete. 4. Upon check out we were charged 2 mini bar fee's for over $100 and $60 for items that we never consumed. Frustrating... dealing with a hotel charge for something you didn't have with two separate phone calls. 5. Requested posture pedic pillows that didnâ€™t arrive until our second night. An IRD order that was never delivered etc etcâ€¦there were other details of the stay but I think you get the picture. On a positive, I will add that while the W Montreal definitely misses the mark on many points they are lucky to have the services of Bridgett Noel, their front office manager. After a poor experience with noise on Friday night, I told Bridgett about our night and gave her the opportunity to change our experience. She was empathetic, professional and beyond helpful. She did get us into a room with a window, got our postuerpedic pillows and did send the complimentary breakfast which was very appreciated. Bridgett is the star of the hotel and a true hospitality professional...they just need more people like her working there. While she tried to fix our experience the staff was unable to deliver and too many things fell through the cracks. This property doesn't speak well for the W brand... which has some lovely hotels, just not in Montreal.

Reviews.Title: “What amazing at W Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Jordan M
Reviews.Content: Be honest if you are over 27 usually W staff are not as nice as the hotel itself. First time the staff matches the splendor of hotel. Room was huge and comfortable. Location great. And Phillippe at front desk is bar none the most helpful person ever at not only a W but in all Montreal I knew a little of Montreal but he guided us through the whole trip. THANK Phillippe.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing, was expecting much more.... go elsewhere!!”
Reviews.Author: isalarouche
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel in October 2011 for 4 nights. I was expecting a lot, and was disappointed a lot. Here are the pros and cons: Pros: 1) nicely located hotel, access to metro/subway directly inside the hotel 2) very comfy beds 3) nicely decorated 4) mini bar with lots of choice and possibility to make your own drinks (multitudes of glasses and shaker available) 5) very polite and helpful staff 6) movies in the room 7) for those who likes to party, access to 2 or 3 bars and loud music (which is also in my cons...) 8) soundproof hotel between rooms (BUT not from outside!!) Cons: 1) Dirty (jam found on door; hair found in the bath and shower; shower not clean under the shower curtain; dust everywhere in the room and on the glasses/bottle of wine; fingerprints everywhere on the window) - we had 2 rooms, both were the same! 2) Very expensive valet parking (35$ a night plus taxes!!) 3) Very expensive room service (120$ for 2 persons breakfast - not the extensive ones: coffees, bagel and jam, eggs and potatoes and 2 toast! not even an orange juice... 4) Food very disappointing: you order fruit and yogurt, one day you get full of fruits, the other day, because it is later during the day you receive 3 berries and 1 strawberry (I am not joking!) and 2 berries had mold on them. I called room service to have more fruits (it is FRUITS and yogurt, right?!? for 14$... I want some.... and the room service guy almost threw the bowl into my face....?!? I was very polite, promise, I don`t think they should react like that and the food should be the same, day after day, right??) 5) Very loud hotel, when you are tired or with young children, that is not the place to go. Very dark at night like a bar and very loud music. People drink everywhere, you really feel out of place... 6) My beautiful bath did not hold the water in!!! So sad, I planned my night to take a nice quiet bath without the kids, and the water did not stay in, so disappointed! 7) Not an extensive choice of free supplies in comparison to other 4-5 stars hotel 8) very expensive spa with not an extensive choice of services (if you want a massage, ok, but they don`t do nails, facial or any other aesthetic treatments) 9) small room 10) expensive movies (16$ and more) for new release. So, in review, I don`t think the regular joe should stay there. If you don`t have an extra $ to spend, go elsewhere, because you will find the bill at the end quite difficult to swallow! My recommendation as a frequent traveler: find another place to stay, follow tripadvisor people`s advice.... stay away....

Reviews.Title: “W Montreal: â€�Wâ€� for â€œW"orth-less or â€œWâ€�orst in classâ€� ?”
Reviews.Author: oliviercale
Reviews.Content: It started as an attempt to stay at a younger/cooler downtown venue than the usual residential 4star classic or luxury boutique hotels. We are seasoned world business travelers but also take pleasure in trying ,every once in a while, new or different formats to challenge our old habits and keep a fresh , open attitudeâ€¦ However, after 5 mn inside the dark , sad looking lobby, we realized that this trendy W brand is sadly nothing but a mere packaging of an overrated, "has been" & unprofessionally run franchise: from pics on their website that featured a non-existing fireplace lobby area to a cramp skinny lobby with a cheap 70â€™s vinyl street side bar that doesnâ€™t open before 8 pm, to an appalling level of service (i.e. female concierge attendant who sends you to the middle of a residential area for a rather average version of the local food specialty â€œpoutineâ€�â€¦or 45 mn delivery time for an in-room breakfast on a Sat. morning that came with cold scrambles eggs, missing milk, salt etcâ€¦) to their cheap plastic curtain that is used to separate the bedroom from the bathroom (and we had picked a superior/bigger room !) or the fixed shower-head mounted in the 7 foot ceiling that rains all over the place (pathetic architecture savings posing as hot design ideas ?!), this whole customer experience canâ€™t justify for a second the $350 average nightly fare in Montreal that will get you otherwise in serious adjascent hotels like the Intercontinental , Westin or even the St james (old British gentlemanâ€™s club style in a gorgeous bank building with a modern twist...). I guess this Starwood group division is too busy expanding around the world and merchandising the W style factor via vacuous ads or second rate DJ music to keep their eye on the ball for their current business base and actual customer delivery..? So...real cool crowds of all ages and walks of life, forget the overated W crap till they get their house in orderâ€¦.and go for real fun & bang for your buck hospitality business that doesnâ€™t try too hard and actually delivers ! Bon voyage !

Reviews.Title: “A little disappointing”
Reviews.Author: Gedner
Reviews.Content: I really wanted to like the W Montreal but was a bit disappointed, especially in comparison to other W hotels. Our room was absolutely tiny and the layout less than ideal. The room was very dark overall and our window faced an interior, enclosed lobby space which did not appear to be part of the hotel. The room itself was almost inaccessible for to people. You literally couldn't pass by the bed when accessing the wardrobe. As other travelers mentioned, we also experienced some noise problems from the nightclub below bu just one night. On the bright side, service was great and made up for some of the obvious design flaws.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, best for younger people”
Reviews.Author: bluJ
Reviews.Content: We stayed here with 3 kids. Two had their own room and the youngest, 9, was in the room with us. This is a very nice hotel, clean, close to the old city. I think that it is best suited for a younger couple, here is why: the room we stayed in had a tub that was part of the living area, well, kind of separated but there is no privacy. The rooms are very modern and I could imagine older people getting frustrated with not being able to figure out how to operate some things. I have traveled with my Mom and had to show her plenty of times how to turn on the water or flush the toilet. Both nights that we were there we had to put up with very load music that was coming from the building next door, I have no idea if there is a club there or a place with parties. It was very loud and it went on till after 1 am. All in all, the staff were very helpful, held our extra luggage when we went to Quebec city. We did not eat at the hotel, chose to have breakfast in a small cafe. I would stay here again but request a room far from the noise.

Reviews.Title: “Do you want your room cleaned during your stay with us?”
Reviews.Author: vesperalley
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the W at around 2:30 in the afternoon. The location in the heart of downtown Montreal is just a stones throw from the Victoria metro station. We were however a little bit out off by the field of protesters camping outside (the centre for commerce is located almost next door). Entering the hotel your immediately made to feel at home. The lounge area oozes style, the receptionist very polite and welcoming. We were asked the strangest of questions..... Did we want to have our room cleaned, linen changed and bed made during our stay? We looked blank at each other as we have never been asked this in a hotel before EVER, we felt under pressure to agree with the request but managed to hold our own and said that we would like the room cleaned in the normal manner (I mean what are we paying Â£250 per night for?). On to the room... Very clean (Monica Gellar would have been proud). Not a single spec of dust or dirt anywhere. The linen and towels were spotless, soft and well ironed. The pillows a little too plump (although there is a pillow menu), the bed was a little bit short in length compared to other top end hotels. TV was huge HDTV and for once it actually worked straight away and had lots of channels to choose from. Only bad points were that the window did not open at all (9th floor) not even to let a whisper of air in. The noise from adjoining rooms was very clear and had to resort to ear plugs on the last night. The wifi internet was very expensive (however if you connect whilst in the lounge/bar it's free and they when you return to your room the connection lasts). The concierge was very helpful and whenever we bumped into staff around the hotel they were always polite and helpful. No tea or coffee making facilities in the room. However there is complimentary coffee served between 6-10am in the lounge (no complimentary pastries as advertised). The fridge didn't work either. The one big issue we had was that EVERYTHING in the room seemed have a price tag attached. Even small bottles of water were $5.

Reviews.Title: “aWsome!”
Reviews.Author: Mimi68Ontario
Reviews.Content: Superior decor, superior service and superior room....on the expensive side but, then again, it's Montreal, or should I say, it's a different world?

Reviews.Title: “Very Good, Definitely Better than Those Ranked Ahead on TripAdvisor”
Reviews.Author: RNG1008
Reviews.Content: My fiancee and I visited from NY and stayed for a weekend and loved our experience. Service was good, a much nicer, less trashy W Hotel than some of the others in big "trendy" cities (i.e., Miami, San Fran, etc.). Service was excellent, room was nice (albeit small, but typical). Location was also convenient. My only constructive critism is that they should have two conciernge staff members so there is less of a wait for service at times. But other than that, the W Montreal is excellent. Especially when considering the other hotels theoretically ranked ahead of the W Montreal on TripAdvisor, this hotel is exponentially better (not even in the same class).

Reviews.Title: “Awsome montreal escape”
Reviews.Author: cberenguer
Reviews.Content: We are Starwood points collectors and this place is what we look forward to on our yearly montreal visit. Here's why: Location - steps to shopping (downtown area), historic area, waterfront. Restaurants and beautiful sights galore!!! Rooms- very ultra mod and chic. A nice change from The typical hotel room and European Montreal feel. Soap- sounds silly but the room soaps and shampoos that this chain offers is amazing!!! Whatever whenever- they mean it! Anything you need they an arrange for you ($ of coourse) Park just a couple minutes up the street walk from the hotel. 1/2 the price and easier access to your vehicle.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location”
Reviews.Author: MaxwellGirl
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the W in october 2011 for a weekend. Our room was one of the larger suites, in $300 range. It was very spacious for a W room. The cleaning service was prompt and the large soaker tub was great for a bath. This W is a 15 minute walk from the main shopping area and a stone's throw from some fabulous restaurants (try Cartet for breakfast on McGill, absolutely delicious). Downsides? The gym did not have a tv you could watch while on the treadmills, you had to crain your neck (I know not the end of the world but still, this is a W hotel after all) and the king bed was really uncomfortable, my husband and I commented to each other unabated in the am. All in all, a great property, centrally located with trendy, funky rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional”
Reviews.Author: David S
Reviews.Content: I recently had a bit of work to conduct in Montreal. I selected the W Montreal for my stay and couldn't be more pleased. Sandeep, the sales manager, coordinated everything with my office and was an absolute pleasure to work with. Daniel, the concierge extraordinaire, was a true delight. His taste is impeccable and it was reflected in all of his recommendations. Beyond his knowledge and professionalism, though, he's simply a charming and dashing gentleman who was a pleasure to be around. The property itself is lovely. We stayed in a wow suite and I must say that the view from the shower was worth the price of admission. The layout, like that of the hotel, is funky, young and cool. Ultimately, if you don't hate style and fun, the W Montreal is a superior hotel choice.

Reviews.Title: “Unbelievable customer service”
Reviews.Author: Mike M
Reviews.Content: Context: I'm not a very worldly traveller but I've stayed in lots of North American hotel rooms for business and pleasure over the last 5 years. I went to the W Montreal the weekend of October 29th to celebrate a special occassion with my girlfriend. The W Montreal is everything it is advertised to be and more. The hotel itself is pristine and one of the most beautifully modern hotels I've ever came across. The location is perfect; walking distance from almost everything (Old Montreal, downtown, etc). The real selling point of this amazing hotel are the people who work there. Upon finding about a special occassion my girlfriend and I were celebrating, the customer service staff (Wherever\Whatever team) gave us a free upgrade to an amazing suite as well as free drinks and chocolate strawberries. Every staff person we came across was insanely friendly and helpful and made us feel pampered at all times. The hotel does fall in the upper price range, but it is worth every penny... I've spent alot on fancy hotels before, but this has been the only time I have been truly satisfied and felt that what I received was worth the money I paid. The bed we had was unbelievable by the way... like sleeping on a cloud. I honestly think that anyone who complains about this hotel must have a personal axe to grind or something. I cannot see how anyone cannot love this hotel and the staff (particularly Hugo Marques, and his team).

Reviews.Title: “Stylish and luxurious”
Reviews.Author: ClevelandTravels
Reviews.Content: The W was very stylish and had luxe details in the rooms. In particular, it had a huge shower and sink area; there was also a lovely chaise lounge. We stayed two nights using Starpoints. We found the location very convenient to the Metro and Old Montreal (as other people have mentioned, the Occupy Montreal movement is right out front, but we just found it interesting). The cards and other materials in the rooms advertise "whatever, whenever" service, and that really seemed to be true. We had uniformly good service, including retrieving a cord from our rental car which was done very quickly. We also went to the lounge bar upstairs, which seemed to have a mix of guests and non-guests and served up creative cocktails. Each hallway is bluish and dimly lit, with changing light displays. I take away a star for a few things. We were assigned to an interior-view room, which was fairly small. The bed, described as a queen, seemed more like a full; my fiance's feet were hanging off the end, and we struggled to stay asleep. Extras were too expensive on top of an already-high room rate. Internet was $29 for two days, and parking was $30 per day. I'd recommend the rooms more for a couples weekend than for friends because of the clear-glass shower.

Reviews.Title: “Our special place to stay in Montreal”
Reviews.Author: CartQueen61
Reviews.Content: The W Montreal is a special and "wonderful" hotel that I stay in for business and my husband adores coming to stay with me on those odd weekend or two that I am traveling over a weekend. It is a special hotel - the staff are terrific - the rooms have a fabulous feel to them. It is worth spending the extra dollars to move up to a "wonderful" room. Add this hotel to your list of stays when you are in Montreal - close to old Montreal and some amazing restaurants. A visit to the spa is another thing to add to your list too. Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay at the W Hotel in Montreal”
Reviews.Author: travelbug857
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the W Hotel for 2 nights prior to boarding a cruise ship. We found the staff to be pleasant and very accommodating. The first night, we arrived late and were given a less than perfect room. They were very understanding and changed our room the next morning. The concierge Mire was superb. Every one of her recommendations was exceptional, and her knowledge of the city was great. The Metro is accessible through the basement of the hotel, and it is an easy walk to Old Montreal, and most of the important sites in the city. The bed linen and bed comfort were amazing and unlike any I have experienced in any other hotel. I would highly recommend this hotel for whatever your needs may be. They even gave us bottles of water prior to our departure.

Reviews.Title: “Take notice of the Occupy Montreal outside the doors.”
Reviews.Author: Bearcatbert
Reviews.Content: I hesitate to write a bad review considering how pleasant and helpful the staff at the W was during our stay this past weekend. The concierge and bell staff couldn't have been more helpful in finding restaurants and giving directions. However, in Square Victoria right outside the front doors is the demonstrators Occupy Montreal sleeping in their tent city. Mostly, they are quiet and don't interfere with hotel customers. However, at night they hold concerts (thrash metal), bang drums and pots, along with using their bullhorn and mics. Most nights we were here yet quieted down around 11 pm. But they use those bullhorns during the day which will prevent you from napping and if you want to be in your room before 11, forget about quiet. The manager on duty, Hugo, was kind enough to give us earplugs and breakfast in the morning for our trouble. It's certainly not the hotels fault nor will the police do anything to quiet the noise. So if you don't think the time frame of the noise will bother you, it's a lovely hotel. But if you want to relax, maybe call first to see if the group is still out there.

Reviews.Title: “Wanted to Like it More”
Reviews.Author: voyagemom
Reviews.Content: As this was our first "W" experience - I was really looking forward to staying at the W Montreal. They generously upgraded our room to one with 2 queen beds upon a written request. However, the double queen room was atrium facing with a connecting door. We found it very disconcerting not to be able to see outside. The hotel is dimly lit and the atrium facing rooms are completely devoid of daylight. This particular room was poorly soundproofed as we could hear absolutely everything from the room next door. To make matters worst - there was no hot water our first night & we struggled to try to figure out what we were doing wrong with the "design" shower & tubs. To be fair - when I shared our dissatisfaction with reception - they did not hesitate to figure out how to make us more comfortable and found us a park facing king room immediately which was available later that day. Plus they informed us that there was a hot water issue throughout the hotel. Why that was not shared upon check in or during the late afternoon is a bit disappointing. We vastly preferred the park facing room. Location & service at the W cannot be beat. However, the actual rooms & their design did not live up to our expectations. Potential guests should also be aware that the W literally overlooks the headquarters for "Occupy Montreal". There were speakers (with mikes), bands, films, drumming all afternoon which we could hear even on the 8th floor. Personally, we found it fascinating and only enriched our stay. Plus it does quiet down at a certain point in the evening.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay, amazing staff and service”
Reviews.Author: rs231
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a perfect blend of service, charm and chic. I checked in very early (10 am). My room was not ready but they gave me access to a smaller room so that I could rest and change. Later that afternoon they upgraded me to a suite (absolutely amazing). Ever interaction from the valet to the room service server was polite, professional and prompt. I was very impressed !

Reviews.Title: “Great Spot”
Reviews.Author: Bryson D
Reviews.Content: The hotel was beautiful and located in a great spot. The front desk was helpful and made my mother and I very comfortable. I hate that I can't remember the name of the afternoon shift front desk agent with the brown hair and darker skin but I also want to thank Francis the driver and Penelope (Spell Check) from In Room Dining for being great ambassadors for the hotel

Reviews.Title: “Don't stay here if you expect to actually sleep.”
Reviews.Author: LALANYC30
Reviews.Content: I wouldn't recommend this hotel if you are looking to actually sleep while you are there. The point of staying in a hotel, right? Apparently on Wednesdays they have a nightclub in the hotel. So unless you like listening to Rick James and Justin Timberlake at 3 in the morning I would find another hotel. Disappointing for sure since the rooms are nice and the location is good. But none of that really matters to a business traveler if they can't get a good night's sleep. This is not the first time this has happened to me at a W. I think I'm going to drop Starwood Hotels altogether. Maybe they should just open a chain of nightclubs? That way everyone's happy. No more disgruntled business travelers and the club kids still have some place cool to go on Wednesday nights. I won't be back ... unless I somehow magically morph into a rock star. To be fair they comped my room for the night which is actually for both parties. I paid for a place to sleep. I couldn't sleep, so they don't get paid. Still, seeing as I was on business trip, I'd rather have had a good night's sleep.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding stay!!”
Reviews.Author: BforBoy
Reviews.Content: This is my 3rd time staying at this W Montreal and my last stay was perfect!! Because of my platinum status, I was automatically upgraded to a fantastic suite. The room was huge and beautiful!!! The location of this hotel is amazing! The staff are very friendly and helpful!! I will definitely go back there again!!! Good job!

Reviews.Title: “Cool chic luxury”
Reviews.Author: Ken J
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the W Montreal, and to my utter joy the hotel staff and facilities were sophisticated yet trend and fun!! Mirelle and Maxime at the concierge were world class and Brigette Dumas in the lobby, was a god send!The greek bartender in the minibar lounge was awesome! The room was out of this world! didn't get a chance to eat in the restaurant, but next time-for sure! Will definetly be back again!

Reviews.Title: “Modern hotel in good location”
Reviews.Author: sunshineliz
Reviews.Content: A very modern and funky hotel - which you know from the moment you walk in. Service was excellent - the conceriege especially was very helpful. The bar staff were also chatty - and made a special effort. The cocktails were good! The rooms themselves were spacious and well equipped with a humourous edge to the accessories. Room service was prompt. The bar in the hotel turns into a proper night spot later on, but it's well managed by staff so doesn't impinge on the hotel. Definitely a good night out - and very quick to stumble home if you do. The spa is very peaceful, the treatment I had was good and well presented and a not bad valueI (for a hotel). The only thing that would make this hotel perfect is access to a pool. The location is good for the old town - only a short walk away. It's also conveniently located to a metro station so access to other places is straightforward and not far to walk either. Overall a good place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “A hotel which is a 'piece of Art'”
Reviews.Author: Teacherbear
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in prime location both shopping and visiting olde Montreal. The decor of the hotelmis very unique. When you first entee the lobby you know you are in a special place. This feeling continues with the service accorded on at reception. The entire staff whether in the bar, restaurant, front desk or concierge are both friendly, and knowlegeable. The room decor is very artsy and modern. This taste is not for everyone but well done. The view we had was great and the size of the room was good. They are not large rooms but sufficient. They are not large rooms but very functionable. The hotel certainly goes the extra mile, we were offered a ride to our next hotel, which was a nice extra. I would certainly book this property again, mainly for the wonderful staff!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel in the Heart of Montreal”
Reviews.Author: Bethygirl22
Reviews.Content: The W Hotel is a wonderful setting in the beautiful heart of Montreal City. Centrally located to a number of restaurants, bars & scenic parks, you really won't be disappointed. The hotel itself is contemporary without being pretentious and the staff excell in customer service.

Reviews.Title: “Location, heavenly beds, service, spa. The best Montreal has to offer.”
Reviews.Author: MaPeacetravels
Reviews.Content: The W is situated on Square Victoria, at the junction of downtown, Chinatown and Old Montreal, and about one block from the Palais des Congres. You can walk to everywhere within 10-15 minutes. The decor is chic, hip, now, and clean. The rooms are very spacious, with great Bliss Spa products, and the beds ultra-comfortable after a day exploring the city. Everyone on staff, from valet, reception, concierge, room service to spa personnel, is amazing: welcoming, knowledgeable and friendly. I usually stay there for those reasons and I can stay that the level of performance from the staff is consistent. That definitely says something about the leadership! I understand that their staffing of spa personnel is such that they choose experienced therapists. My therapist, Michael Brumarescu, was extremely knowledgeable regarding physiology and nutrition (which I happen to know a thing or two about). While many may want to choose to eat in any of the thousand amazing restaurants in Montreal, the room service menu offers very fresh food with many very healthy choices. Oh, and it's only a few minutes walk to Chuck Hughes' Gard'Manger, and ToquÃ©. Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “Very chic, clean, pleasant friendly, atmosphere.”
Reviews.Author: CJLesch
Reviews.Content: Beautiful, modern, very friendly place to stay. Everyone from door men to the 8th floor stylist Mary wonderful job. Thank you for making our stay in Montreal a wonderful experience.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing suite. Great service.”
Reviews.Author: KikiDhollywood
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a suite at the W Montreal in August and had a really wonderful time. The beds are extremely comfortable, great bliss products in the bathroom, lots of space and great view of the Square Victoria.

Reviews.Title: “simply amazing”
Reviews.Author: placos
Reviews.Content: you know what they location location location , and the W montreal couldnt have a better location . the staff the hotel the food and wow the bar , W wednesday just amazing . make sure to hit the spa , best massage I got in a very long time .

Reviews.Title: “great hotel for the young”
Reviews.Author: patrick_dumoulin
Reviews.Content: great style very nice staff may not be the place for older poeple.would be nice tohave own room in the fridge to put your drinks in .THe bar in the hotel is wonderful quite expensive tho. Also got a ride in the acura was a great service. the gym area was very nice also had apples ready for you . Also they do try to make more money anyway they can but thats buisness i would defenetly stay there again in perfect location.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place for younger crowd”
Reviews.Author: Frstrated
Reviews.Content: Stayed on SPG points. Greeted very nicely by front desk staff and given a room upgrade. Being alone it was no problem but it us worth mentioning that the bathroom has no privacy. On the positive side the housekeeping (sorry Room Stylist) person Mary was helpful, courteous and efficient. Access by metro was very convenient. If you are into the bar scene this is the place for you. For what it is and the market they are seeking it is very well executed

Reviews.Title: “gorgeous but guests deserve a little more TLC.”
Reviews.Author: kfamily570
Reviews.Content: The decor of the W is awe inspiring as per expected. The rooms themselves are beatiful and spacious. What we found slightly odd was the lack of privacy in the bathroom/shower area. There is a cut out in the living room and bathroom where one could see both in and out. Rather than a door on the bathroom area there is a curtain, which is interesting but not that appealing. While we were enjoying our stay, we received a knock on the door informing us that we were being very loud and that there had been complaints. I had been in the shower and my husband and 2 children were just talking to each other. we were confused to say the least. It made a little more sense, when we tried going to sleep and realized we could hear our neighbors tv as if it was in our own room. I have never before experienced such thin walls! The staff is efficient enough but very cold, and uninterested, even though we are starwood members. All in all I would say it is a very nice looking hotel in a good location.

Reviews.Title: “Was great but not the Best !!”
Reviews.Author: Marc-Andre B
Reviews.Content: First of all, would like to explain that i go there maybe 2x times per year so since 5 years , i maybe went there 10 times. I go there beacuse the prefered rate i have with my company is perfect. I also enjoy the '''nightclub'' experience even during the day... When you enter there it's like entering in a lounge restaurant or lounge club. The staff like personnal bodyguards always take care of you in any time. For the room : Well perfect, nothing to say, the bed is also almost great For the frontdesk here is a little problem, i got sometimes people maybe too much profesionnal or not funny at all... But it's ok... I would like to say that i'm a fan of making a wish and that the concierge try to accomodate that wish comes true. The concierge is a true Montreal ressource for doing whatever you wants ! Well finally, we had the chance to go to the club but all the seat was reserved, so we went to the other club at the 2nd level, nice but cold... My recommendation is : If you are young trendy and like to have an hotel that is not like the other one ; this is good for you. Hope to receive more service next time i'm coming Still a great hotel so far !

Reviews.Title: “Wowed above and beyond!”
Reviews.Author: Jim H
Reviews.Content: This particular W property is one of my favorites out of all the W's that Starwood offers. The main difference is the outstanding service. As a Platinum guest, we were treated like royalty. Plus, I'm not a huge fan of restaurant food, but the hotel's restaurant, Otto's has some of the best bagels and eggs benedict dishes that are out there - and it wasn't outrageously priced. The hotel's assistant manager and the concierge were very helpful prior to our arrival and made the hotel stay an absolutely impeccable one.

Reviews.Title: “Another Fantastic Stay”
Reviews.Author: MiamiBeachPaul
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at this W several times, for both businss and pleasure. Once again my stay was excellent! The only thing I'd mention is that many of the rooms in this hotel don't have much in the way of views. I actually got one of these rooms when I checked in, and when I complained I was told the hotel was sold out so there was nothing they could do (understandable). Then I got a bottle of wine sent to my room from the manager on duty and phone call letting me know that they were truely sorry and the next day they'd move me to a suite (with a view). It was an exceptional response to a minor complaint. This is the kind of service I've learned to expect from this hotel, and W hotels in general.

Reviews.Title: “Typically Posh W Hotel, but Tighter Than Usual”
Reviews.Author: Songer5
Reviews.Content: The W brand is my favorite hotel, so I was pleased to see the W Montreal lived up to the high standards. My wife and I drove up from NYC for Labor Day weekend and booked the room with SPG points. The location is excellently suited for those who want to check out the Vieux Montreal (5-10 minute walk) and also steps away from the Metro if you're more into Mont Royal part of town. It's a quick find coming off the highway. They could use a valet sign but it's fairly obvious where to pull up. They charge C$35/night for parking. Check-in was prompt and while they were unable to upgrade me, they did give me a late checkout. The lobby was beautifully designed but it was not as large/welcoming as other W Hotels (for example, W Hollywood, W Washington DC or W San Diego). It was more like a comfortable waiting area than somewhere you'd lounge around with your friends. Additionally, the Concierge seemed to be overwhelmed as there was perpetually a line of guests waiting for advice. Our room was on the 7th floor and small (think college dorm room) but we expected that since we booked with SPG points. Nevertheless, we weren't planning on spending a lot of time in the room so we didn't need a large space. BIG NOTE: The shower is see-through so that you can see everything from the bed area. Not a big deal if you're with your wife/husband, but obviously an issue for non-couples sharing a room. The bed was amazing as you'd expect from a Starwoods property and the design was stylish and modern. Could have used some more outlets to recharge your phone/laptop but not a big deal. Also, the internet was C$20 for 24 hours (set start/end times of 12PM-1159AM). The 3rd floor bar is where you want to be to start the evening and the hostess was very helpful securing a seat for my wife and I even if many of the seats were taken. We didn't make it to the ground floor bar but they had the velvet rope and clipboard out for the standard weekend party crowd. Also for Americans, you can get by without using any Canadian dollars (except for Taxis). The W staff said they can call specific taxi's that accept US$ but we just walked everywhere. Also if using US credit cards (Canadians have a special chip in their credit cards), some restaurants allow you to tip after charging the card, but oddly enough, many others don't so you should have some Canadian dollars to tip just in case. Most of the time, they accepted US Visa and Mastercard, but smaller places (for example: Tim Horton's) didn't accept either.

Reviews.Title: “Great Weekend Getaway”
Reviews.Author: Passport-Kid
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel in may 2010 and found it was a great weekend getaway as a couple. The location is very central and close to the main shopping area (st catherines street). It was our first time at the W and we were blown away by the design of the rooms. Defo worth spending the extra money for the experience.

Reviews.Title: “Good enough for me, good enough for Ferrari!”
Reviews.Author: nycman17
Reviews.Content: One of the Best Wâ€™s I have stayed in! I have stayed here every time I travel to Montreal which is several times a year. The W Montreal is located a few blocks from St. Catherineâ€™s street and a few blocks from Old Montreal; perfect location. Bathroom sink area is open to the room; this could be closed by pulling a curtain. However some people may not like this as it doesnâ€™t give much privacy. Be aware of staying on the lower floors, since the music from the lounge/bar located on the first floor comes up to the floors below 4. They have a very nice restaurant and staff was great. Stayed here one year during the Formula 1 race and to my surprise team Ferrari was using the W Montreal as its official hotel. Good enough for me and Ferrari!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service”
Reviews.Author: sharon800
Reviews.Content: I had really good experience with them. When i arrived I thought we request to change bed to allergy free bed. They did but I thought they didn't and then the manger come to our room aplogize and give us whole breakfast free meal which cost $100 the room is big and clean

Reviews.Title: “Worst service ever experienced in the cocktail lounge and way overpriced”
Reviews.Author: traveldish
Reviews.Content: Did not stay at this hotel but visited the cocktail lounge for drinks before dinner. Expected good service and quality for a $15 dollar martini. On previous occasions service had been better. It took 10 min for one server to drop off a drink menu (which we didn't need) and run. A second server returned about 10 minutes later only to leave for another 10 min to ask if the bartender could make a cosmopolitan martini. Shockingly the answer was "no" however they could make a cosmo drink - go figure. Similar confusion over a request for a blood orange martini - even though they could make a blood orange margarita. We watched the bartender talk to patrons rather than mixing drinks. After just over 1/2 hr we got our 3 drinks with a $45 bill. Not once did the server say hi, apologize for the wait, or be friendly. The bill was dropped without a word nor were we asked if we would like another cocktail. We were friendly, polite and courteous but entirely disappointed. Montreal is my favourite place for great restaurants and service. This place is by far my worst experience and I would not even consider staying in the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Maybe because we used points...”
Reviews.Author: blcy
Reviews.Content: We used 10,000 SPG points for a night at the W. They gave us a barrier-free room near the fire escape with windows looking into the atrium of an office building. I don't mean across the street; I mean looking right into the atrium. You could even see people's workstations from our room. Naturally, we drew the curtains during our entire stay. Because it was a barrier-free room, our bathroom looked nothing like the other photos with the glass wall and bathtub. We did ask about switching to a room with a street view but was told the hotel was full. Might be true; also true that we weren't "paying guests." Other points about the property: 1. The location is pretty good, midway between downtown Montreal and old Montreal. There is a subway (metro) stop just right across the street 2. Valet parking is CDN $35 per night 3. Room is overall clean but basic. This year alone, I stayed at a number of Starwood properties in Asia, incl W Taipei, Westin Beijing (Chaoyang), Sheraton Shenzhen (Dameisha), etc. In comparison, this room is not at the same quality as the ones I have stayed in Asia. For example, no complimentary bottled water in room. You can pay $2 for a bottle of Fiji water they provide. No slippers provided, but there is bathrobe. Building materials are more basic. Of course, we may just be spoiled in Asia. 4. Wifi is free Overall, decent hotel, but not luxury

Reviews.Title: “Very Cool... one of the top W Hotels”
Reviews.Author: phxtravelguy
Reviews.Content: Just had a long weekend with friends in Montreal... stayed at the W Montreal. We booked the fantastic suite which was incredible... tons of windows, amazing bathroom, great location. The room was huge, great couches which let us hit the minibar and hang with our friends... and bed is truly awesome. The bars in the hotel were so cool... a great scene, not pretentious, just very cool. Loved the hotel... definitely the #2 best W out there (Santiago Chile is #1!). If you go to Montreal, stay here. btw - our friend got a massage and said the spa was great too.

Reviews.Title: “The Best Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Robin S
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for one week, the experience was amazing. The suite was over the top, huge soaking tub, incredible view. The staff accomodated in every way and anything they could do to improve the experience, they did. Metro is across the street, Old Town a few blocks away, I will definitely return on my next trip to Montreal, it was wonderful.

Reviews.Title: “25th wedding anniversary MEMORABLE - WONDERFUL”
Reviews.Author: Duffeh
Reviews.Content: My wife and I celebrated our 25th anniversary with a trip to Montreal, and the W was really splendid. We had taken a red eye from Los Angeles and arrived early on a Saturday morning (around 9:30AM). The staff made it a priority to see to it that our room was ready for us as soon as cleaning staff could make it up. The VERY helpful concierge recommended a couple of fabulous options for breakfast, and by the time that we were well fed and back to the hotel (10:45?), the room was ready and it was fantastic. Large windows, nice views of the square and at night enormous blue curtains drawn for a very cozy / mod blue lit room. Way cool. Workout room is great. Proximity to metro (across the street) puts tons at your fingertips. Located within walking of old city and train station, university, shopping... The staff was so kind and helpful, especially when I flailed when trying to speak French. The people who work here genuinely seem to want their guests to have a great visit, and they are quite conscious of their TripAdvisor rating as they asked if I had read the review. I am more than happy to write them an excellent rating. It was a great stay. Great staff.

Reviews.Title: “For business and/or leisure a WONDERFUL place to stay”
Reviews.Author: LuisNMEX
Reviews.Content: Hotels, as many other services could be evaluated according to their price and level of satisfaction you got from them. My stay at the W was an experience... the hotel is chic, trendy, comfortable, well located, has a good room service and a nice restaurant. If you don't feel like going out, the wunderBAR could be the spot for one night. The concierge and staff in general are very kind and really do Whatever/Whenever to grant your satisfaction. There are many good restaurants, shopping malls, the Old Montreal and many other points of interest just a couple of minutes walk.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing place to stay”
