Reviews.Author: theflyingmango
Reviews.Content: I'm having a wonderful time here at the W Hotel. Great customer service. Julie-Catherine, Pauline, Lucas, Kristine, Joena, Nicholas, Dorine, Jason, Catherine, Alan, and Gabrielle at the front desk were attentive to my needs and went above and beyond the "WOW" standard in accommodations and awesomeness. My wonderful stay started with Julie-Catherine and Pauline. These two Front Desk Angels not only placed me on a cloud (best room), but continued to look after me for the past 2 weeks. These two individuals prompted me to pay attention to the rest staff of the hotel. They really did go "Above and Beyond." I was amazed at how organized each department was and the attention to detail applied in their day to day tasks/actions. FYI, Pauline knows the best desert place in Montreal. Alex, Max times 2, Karl, Mathieu, Patrice, Carl, and Jose who are Ambassadors/Valets coupled with Daniel, Mireille, and Max (the Concierge) provided the best Whatever/Whenever experience. They dropped me off several times to Chu Chai (restaurant), pick up deserts, and even took me to La Banquise to get some late night food when I was hungry. The Ambassadors at this W are down to earth, super friendly, and wonderful people to just spend time talking with (especially about the city of Montreal). Daniel, you have been an amazing concierge. I really enjoy talking with you. You make everything fun. I would also like to thank the Welcome Desk Managers. Francois H, Francois P, Alexandra, and Brigitte for taking the time to say hello and taking care of me ninja style. :). You guys are the best. The communication line between the departments make this a desirable place to stay because everything is so smooth starting from check in (it has been for me every time). Even if I haven't had the pleasure meeting everyone in the Style department, I wanted to thank you for the super clean operation you have going on here. Thank you Kevin, Xavier, Lucille, and Brenda for managing such a wonderful team. The rooms I've stayed in are super clean with no problems what so ever. I also love the sticky notes the style department leaves behind after cleaning. Special thanks to Audrey for making up my room and leaving a super nice sticky note. Macy from Accounting was super cool playing the credit card game. Even though she doesn't speak with guests as often as the front desk, she was super nice and accommodating. Thank you for going through each day's portfolio with me Macy and having just a wonderful sense of humor. Thank you Sandeep, Claudia, Karyne, Melodie, Eric, Genevieve from Marketing for the call and also checking with me in regards to my "preference". Room Service team. Alex, Jeff, Giovani, Jesse, Bettina, Louise, Penelope, and Sebastian. Thank you for restocking the goodies in the room. Jason, Francois, Andy, Sekou, Jose, Max, Brigitte, and Kristine worked the night audit the past week. Thank you all for everything especially the midnight snacks and drinks you guys made possible. Mr. Jean-Francois Pouliot. I personally would like to thank you for a wonderful experience. I was surprised, shocked, and flattered (SSF'ed) the GM was making sure I was enjoying my stay. Talk about service. You have an absolute diamond of a group here. You and your team make this W hotel Shine. It's been my pleasure staying here. Mr. Pouliot and I will stay here whenever I am in Montreal. This was my first time at this property and I am glad I did. Everyone was very humble. The Extreme WOW suite was Amazing. Thank you for the "WOW" experience. Special thank you Julie-Catherine

Reviews.Title: “W Montreal was WOW! Can't wait to go back!”
Reviews.Author: Elizabeth S
Reviews.Content: Met all of our expectations, staff were courteous and polite. The Metro was so convenient and within walking distance of the Old Port, Planetarium (presentations in English or French), Notre-Dame Basilica (highly recommend "And There Was Lightâ€� presentation) http://www.basiliquenddm.org/en/...many great restaurants including the restaurant 'Otto' within W Montreal - love the Tuna Tartare with guacamole. Excellent service received by Brigitte Dumas, Supervisor, W Insider...can't wait to go back! Elizabeth S., Belleville ON

Reviews.Title: “Nocturnal Funk!”
Reviews.Author: Janice51
Reviews.Content: We stayed for three nights recently. It had an excellent location, close to 'Old Montreal' as well as other downtown attractions of Montreal. It was also very close to the subway line.. The staff were very good and we enjoyed the 'Spa' facilities. We thought we would try the Hotel W as we had never experienced one before. We found it very 'funky and modern' with lots of eclectic touches. However, the nocturnal effect was not something that we enjoyed. We would not recommend that people not stay there, but we ourselves would opt to stay at one of the more 'traditional' Starwood locations.

Reviews.Title: “Club feel”
Reviews.Author: universalmgm
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel, great location, excellent service The only downside was the from the lobby to room to even the business lounge and elevators; you constanly felt you were in a night club. Dark, mood lighting and background club music was everywhere. I was longing for some brightness. I guess it's okay if you want to feel your living in one of Montreal's famous night clubs. Overall, I would stay somewhere else next time.

Reviews.Title: “W Montreal sure knows how to take care of its guests!!”
Reviews.Author: Fraser S
Reviews.Content: We booked this trip to the W Montreal at the very last minute, and have been taken care of incredibly well by the team here. The rooms are excellent, the location couldn't be better, and the staff here are truly responsive to every wish we had. They were able to get us a room that matched our wishes, and even found us tickets to the Canadian Open Tennis! Thanks W Montreal, we'll see you next time we're in town...

Reviews.Title: “The best massage ever! Totally recommend it!”
Reviews.Author: norata
Reviews.Content: I had the best massage at the spa of this hotel. Really nice! Reasonable price for a 60 minute total body massage with experienced and friendly staff! Many thanks to Michael Brumarecus for the greatest massage and skin care tips!

Reviews.Title: “If you want to know what you are getting, this is a standard hotel you can count on.”
Reviews.Author: LXChicago
Reviews.Content: The location is great. You can walk everywhere and there are a lot of options. My husband and I love to walk and we got to many prime spots in one day. The service is standard. The room is clean, a bit run down. But for a quick getaway, pretty good.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: Maria_M_Vancouver
Reviews.Content: We stayed two nights at the W Montreal in June and really enjoyed it. The hotel is very cool and modern. The room is beautiful with great ammenities. The location is fantastic - walking distance to shopping on Ste Catherine's and close to the Old Port. Very nice stay.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing decor, scene, and service”
Reviews.Author: gmwaldron
Reviews.Content: The room was very chic yet comfortable. The W offers several bars each with a great scene. Daniel was an enuthasiastic and competent concierge--he helped us make our weekend fun and memorable.

Reviews.Title: “Made our anniversary one we will never forget!”
Reviews.Author: Jennifer_Ann_Arbor
Reviews.Content: We had a most wonderful stay at the W Montreal to celebrate our 10-year anniversary. The service was amazing; we were really made to feel special! Stayed in both the Wonderful Room and a Fantastic Suiteâ€”both were incredible. Loved the views of the Square. Decor is cool and modern. Had a very relaxing massage at the Spa followed by mango smoothies delivered to the roomâ€”heaven! We would definitely stay at the W Montreal again!

Reviews.Title: “Very trendy and in a great location”
Reviews.Author: TravelandLearn_11
Reviews.Content: One of the boutique hotels with lots of cool design features, some more practical than others. For example, the bathroom part of the room was only separated by two floor-to-ceiling curtains - interesting design feature, but really, who wouldn't prefer a bit more privacy in the bathroom.... But then there was a cool lounge chair in the room, bed-side tables which could be illuminated from underneath, and a comfy king-size bed. My only complain? It is apparently still trendy to have a dark hotel. The lobby and elevator gives you a feeling of eternal night time, and even the room is only sparsly lit once all lights are on. Wonder how the cleaning personal does its job? Maybe they bring their own spotlights...

Reviews.Title: “WOW Suite exceeded our expectations”
Reviews.Author: LonnieT
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 4 nights at W Montreal from July 08-12, 2011. Right from the start the stay was outstanding. We arrived early Friday morning after a red-eye flight from the west coast and they were able to get our room cleaned early so we could checkin by 11am. This was much appreciated! We checked into room 1009, one of the WOW Suites on the 10th floor for the hotel. These suites are amazing with their 2 story windows and balconies overlooking Square Victoria. The living room is comfortable for 2-3 people to relax in; there is a powder room on the main floor, mini bar, closet space and drawers. The doors to the balcony are off the living room and provide a great view of Square Victoria and the south shore of Montreal. The balcony is a real treat that we enjoyed much more than we initially exepcted. The balcony was probably 8' by 16' with a chair and a lounger. The balcony dividers between suites provide very little privacy and can be moved to connect to another suite if you have friends with a suite next door to you. Upstairs there is a king bed and an open WOW bathroom consisting of shower, sink and separate toilet. The lofted bedroom and bath have a glass wall overlooking the main floor and 2 story view of the city. The master bathroom was very modern and well laid out. The only issue was with the rainhead shower as the water pressure was a bit low for the 10th floor. The only deficiency I found was with the fitness room. It consisted of cardio equipment and a rack of dumbells. There was no other workout equipment available. If the space is available I would recommend an expansion of the gym and an addition of some workout equipment. The staff at the hotel were fantastic. The doormen, front desk staff, bartenders, and concierge were great to deal with. Their default language is French but as soon as they realize that a guest speaks English they seamlessly switch. They provided great recommendations for attractions, transportation and restaurants. We loved our stay at W Montreal and especially our WOW Suite (1009). We will definitely be back next year!

Reviews.Title: “great! we will be coming back”
Reviews.Author: rachelle5
Reviews.Content: great hotel. anything you want they have or will get for you. If you are looking for fun and music then plan to be there wednesday - saturday. other days is very quiet. My only negative was the gym. I went at 8:30 am and there wasn't any towels or headsets or apples. nobody was there to take care of the place.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Staff, Fun Hotel.”
Reviews.Author: neudoc
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the W Montreal from July 22-25 and really loved it. The staff was amazing, from the reception down to our maid (Mary). They really made the trip seamless and went out of their way to make sure everything was perfect - they even went so far as to help us with plans to our next destination (Quebec City). Genevieve LaVertu went out of her way to help us with our room - as we were friends traveling together, she made sure we would have a room that would give us privacy when using the shower, and she made it very clear that she would be very happy to go the extra mile to help us in any way. The thoughtfulness was really appreciated. The rooms were really sexy - though I was there on a girls trip, I think it would make for a romantic get away. Loved the location. The Metro was right outside the door and so easy to use! Notre Dame basilica was only about a 5 minute walk. Many hotels that have this level of luxury/are this chic are filled with pretentious staff. I was so thrilled to see the opposite at the W - everyone was exceptionally friendly and welcoming. I will certainly stay here again when in Montreal.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous hotel, wonderful service!”
Reviews.Author: rosey1963Toronto
Reviews.Content: First of all, let me be clear I am biased as I love the vibe of the W hotel chain and W Montreal did not disappoint! The staff at the check in desk went out of their way to accommodate me when I arrived at 8am tired from a long flight. My room was not ready so they set me up in the spa after my workout so I could shower and change for lunch. The room was decadent with a soaker tub, shower and king sized TV. Room service was excellent. the location is a little off the beaten path from the scene in the city but easy enough to cab to the night clubs and restaurants plus it's walking distance to the river and old Montreal. If you are splurging or can justify the extra expense, this is the place for you.

Reviews.Title: “AMAZING!”
Reviews.Author: HLLO
Reviews.Content: Just got back from my trip and staying at the W was icing on the cake. In addition to typical W style, the staff was beyond accommodating, friendly and took pride in wanting us to have a good time. In particular, Genevieve was fabulous! She takes the "What you want when you want" seriously and was beyond our wildest expectations. The rooms (we stayed in two) were beautiful. The tubs were huge and even though open privacy wasn't compromised. The "Wow" suite is just that, WOW! Dripping in luxury. The only problem was, we didn't want to leave it to go explore the town. The housekeeper, Mary was wonderful and we loved her. The gym was very nice and enjoyed my workout. This hotel is A+, right down do to them running out to our car as we were leaving with cold bottled water for our trip. I can't wait to return to this hotel!!

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel in Montreal.”
Reviews.Author: JohnBoyMD
Reviews.Content: I've stayed here a few times and each time I do, it never fails to serve as one of the most relaxing hotels I've ever stayed in. My friends and I usually go up and stay a weekend for his birthday in October. It's always very clean, smells great and the staff is always very helpful, expecially the managers and the Concierge. The beds. You haven't slept well until you sleep on their beds. The last time we went, there was an incident where a dumbell fell off the rack in the weight room and fell on my foot. I wasn't annoyed, but told management that the dumbells dont fit on the racks well and it's a little dangerous and should look into it. They comped us a bottle of wine and payed very close attention to us for the remaining two days of our stay. They care about their guests. I highly recommend staying here. I'm coming back with my girlfriend in January.

Reviews.Title: “Tres Manifique”
Reviews.Author: tourists4ever
Reviews.Content: The W Hotel is centraly located in Montreal, you are within walking distance to old and new Montreal. Their concierge service was amazing, the young lady that took care of us, was very friendly, knowledgeable and willing to help with tours, rent a car, tips on restaurants, etc. The restaurant, had a great breakfast menu, there were a couple of little cosmetic problems that need to be addressed like the carpet need to be shampoo or changed from lots of tear and wear, the chairs need to be cleaned, but again, their staff was amazing. The rooms were spacious and clean, different decoration than the normal hotel, but all in great order. We will come back to stay at the W if we ever come back to Montrea;

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Travel_bum99
Reviews.Content: This was the 2nd time I stayed at this hotel and would stay there again if I head back to town. The room was spacious, clean and comfortable. The staff was helpful and courteous.

Reviews.Title: “Everything you would expect from a W”
Reviews.Author: STLSteward
Reviews.Content: Beautiful modern property. I am SPG gold and was upgraded to the mega room. It was beautiful and overlooked the park. It is an open floor plan (bathroom basically in the bedroom), but there is a curtain to close this off. Property is in a central location and the Acura service is also convenient. For SPGs, I was able to stay cash+points, which is always a great option. I also received a late check out (4p).

Reviews.Title: “First time at the W and LOVED it!”
Reviews.Author: gemmellian
Reviews.Content: Needed an overnight stay in Montreal (attended the Eddie Izzard show - Just for Laughs Festival) and usually stay at the Westin (which was fully-booked). It was my first time at the W brand as SPG Gold member. Likes: - Great room (spacious) and amazing decor/accessories - Super comfy bed and sheets - Bliss toiletries +++ - Turn-down service - Great bar on the mezzanine (decor/service excellent) Dislikes: - Wifi with a fee ($15/day): my pet-peeve whenever a high-end hotel charges for something that should ALWAYS be free - Corridors are too dark. It does create an ambiance however. I will be choosing a W hotel again soon for my trip to NYC!

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: OttawaTraveler26
Reviews.Content: Our stay at this hotel was excellent. I had asked for an early check-in and was pleasantly surprised when we arrived at noon and our room was already available. We were able to visit Old Montreal before going to the U2 concert. Was also pleased with our room having been straightened up (curtains drawn, etc.) when we came back late at night. The valet service was very efficient and I liked the fact there were water bottles in the car when we picked it up. All in all, your attention to detail made for a great stay!

Reviews.Title: “watch out for the nighclub”
Reviews.Author: malene1967
Reviews.Content: you can stay in this hotel but don't stay on the 3rd, 4th or 5th floor above the nighclub...

Reviews.Title: “Modern and Chic”
Reviews.Author: Prekol
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the hotel over the long 4th of July weekend with my wife, and were very happy with the room and staff. The room was large and very comfortable with all the modern amenities, the staff was extremely pleasant and helpful. The hotel is located right across the street from a moderately priced parking garage and right across the street from the metro which is a huge convenience. It is also a 15min walk to the old town and great restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: NikoMN
Reviews.Content: Enjoyed a fantastic 4 days in Montreal staying at the W Hotel. The location was excellent, walking distance to Central Station and on the edge of the Old Town. We stayed in a Mega Room on the 9th floor and had a great view of Victoria Square. The room was very spacious and full of all the bells & whistles you expect from a W Hotel. But what really made this hotel great was the Concierge staff... they gave us the best advice on places for Breakfast, Lunch, and Dinner and we had some amazing meals in Montreal we surely would never have had without their help. The Concierge even arranged for the house Acura car to take us to the train station when we left. Montreal is wonderful, but the W Montreal is magnificent.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service and location”
Reviews.Author: rossnewman777
Reviews.Content: Walking distance to charming Old Montreal area, with its chic boutiques, restaurants and bars -- plus extraordinary architecture! The hotel's staff, from doormen to concierge, was excellent. The rooms are "W modern" and work very well, with all the amenities you could want. The food was very good. The crowd, both guests and visitors, was sophisticated and lively. As a regular Montreal Ritz guest, I was very pleasantly surprised.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel in MTL for couples”
Reviews.Author: YOWboys
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed at the W Montreal in March 2011, which was our fifth or sixth stay at the hotel. The service is always excellent (without any of the pretention one might reasonably expect in this type of hotel), and the hotel has a (cultivated) fun but functional faux nightclub atmosphere that makes it perfect for a weekend away. It feels chic and cool while other W hotels canâ€™t quite pull it off and seem to be trying too hard. The extremely dark elevators have mats that are changed from â€œBonjourâ€�to â€œBonsoirâ€� at the appropriate times of day, and there is a signature scent in the public areas of the hotel. Any problems we have had (a malfunctioning in-room safe on one trip and a drain-stop that was not keeping water in the tub on another) have been remedied within minutes by calling the concierge. On one of our stays, we were offered an umbrella at check-out due to particularly heavy rain. We have stayed mostly in Fantastic Suites, which are large and open-concept; the bed area is separated from the sitting area by the television. The deep soaking tub is the centrepiece of the open bathroom with two sinks and a large walk-in rain shower (though we prefer the greater pressure of the Westin showers), as well as a separate room with the toilet. The bathroom can be â€œclosed offâ€� from the rest of the room using a curtain. We have stayed once in a Mega Room, which is slightly smaller and for which the open-concept bathroom is less of a focal point of the room. Each time we have stayed, we have had a park view looking out over Square Victoria. When the hotel had a promotion for spa services, my partner decided to take advantage and get a massage, which he found extremely relaxing. The room layouts we have seen are particularly well suited to couples, a fact that we have enjoyed enough to return to the W just for a weekend out of town. During one stay, however,friends of ours stayed in a room with two double beds and found that the shower layout provides a little less privacy than would be ideal for a group of friends. I would be surprised to see families choosing to stay at this hotel. The hotelâ€™s bars are fun, but they also attract local scenesters, meaning that there is often a line-up in front of the hotel on weekend nights. Hotel guests can still pass through to the lobby without any problems, and we have never had any noise issues while staying here. A word of caution: all Montreal hotels are basically locked down for New Yearâ€™s Eve (all breakables, carpets, etc removed from common areas, some pools drained, and the like) because Quebecâ€™s lower drinking age and Montrealâ€™s party image and proximity to the border attracts an onslaught of American teenagers for the holiday. New Yearâ€™s Eve in Montreal is still absolutely worth it, but be prepared for some rowdiness. The hotel has direct(with guest key card) indoor access to the Square Victoria metro station, which makes getting around the city a breeze, regardless of the weather or traffic. We have found the Acura service at the W to be flexible and useful for getting around town, as well. At the end of the day,this is a very fun hotel with fantastic service. The W is generally our first choice when heading to Montreal.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing”
Reviews.Author: nicksel
Reviews.Content: This is the best hotel I have stayed at in montreal. Very interesting contemporary and modern feel. Staff are amazing and will do anything to help make you stay more enjoyable. Also, I read in previous reviews that staying in a room on the 3rd floor would be a problem due to noise but I found it to be a non issue. Rooms on floor 3 were very quiet. The mega room as large and room, with an large soaking tub (complete with a rubber duck). Also had a Large LCD screen TV with an impressive channel lineup.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: sskny
Reviews.Content: Loved this hotel. Stayed during memorial weekend with my boyfriend. They have a hot bars/lounge scene, their room was really sexy, and everyone in the hotel was really nice. Location was great, right by metro and within walking distance of a lot of sights. The only complaint I had was that their room service breakfast was just ok. I would def stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Chic, cozy, friendly, helpful place to stay”
Reviews.Author: gabrielmizrahi
Reviews.Content: Loved my stay here. Half of my trip was for work, half for pleasure. The staff is absurdly friendly, the rooms beautiful, the neighborhood beautiful... great stay all around. They even left me chocolate covered strawberries when I checked in! Great place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Mega wonderful hotel!”
Reviews.Author: dwyerjenny512
Reviews.Content: Wonderful stay at the W Montreal. Hip and stylish in a convenient location in old Montreal. Lots of cool restaurants and clubs both in the hotel and nearby. Got upgraded to a Mega room (#506) thanks to the very capable Bridget (and my gold SPG status). The bathroom is huge and opens into the room, separated only by a curtain - although there is also a cutout in the wall by the bathtub. Shower is huge with a rain shower head in the ceiling. Wonderfully comfy bed, nice gym, attentive and helpful staff makes for a 5 star stay. Looking forward to returning.

Reviews.Title: “World Class Staff 5 Star Experience”
Reviews.Author: dpwct
Reviews.Content: The W Montreal is top notch in every way. We just stayed 2 nights with two small children. We made a mistake in booking our room and upon arrival Pauline at the front desk arranged for a very reasonable upgrade to a WOW suite. The room was terrific. Pauline continued to look out for us during the remainder of our stay. She delivered world class hospitality. The concierge, Mireille also was tremendously helpful. Suggesting great local (non-tourist) spots for us to explore, and offering great ideas for the kids. We'll be back

Reviews.Title: “My favorite hotel in Montreal, but definitely for the young”
Reviews.Author: DJqc
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the W on many occasions for business. In the summer of 2008 i stayed there for 8 weeks straight. The W is for the young or young at heart. Those not in that headspace will be disappointed and annoyed. In fact, the best way to describe the hotel is as a big nightclub. The lights in the hallways are always dim... And the acid jazz music seems to follow you everywhere you go. The rooms themselves are modern and hip... somewhat retro. Although, the bathrooms in the nicer rooms do open up into the room, which is a bit different... But my favourite feature above all is the bed which is beyond heavenly. I think its even better the Westin's. I think the staff is quite good, however, others have complained of late service and rude waitress. Do avoid the 2nd and 3rd floors, especially on Wednesdays as that is when the lounge becomes a club. Its actually known to be the place to be in Montreal on that night. I'm not sure i'd stay here on my own dime at $300 a night, but that's more a matter of principal than value. One more thing... Avoid Otto the restaurant. Its ok food if you happen to be stuck in the hotel and don't mind the insane markup for room. You are much better off going to the many other restaurants Montreal has to offer (see our other reviews). Plus Toque is right nearby.

Reviews.Title: “The bathrooms are crazy”
Reviews.Author: BryanBerry
Reviews.Content: The hotel is cool but in a way W hotels were cool about 10 years ago. Maybe it's trying too hard-- evidence by the red velvet rope at the main entrance after 10pm. Service is wonderful but the shower has a gladd wall and is visible form the bedroom. Could be awkward if you are sharing the room with a friend. The room was dark even with all the lights on and there seemed to be lots of edges to keep bumping into. the edge of the bed, the desk.. I had a few bruises.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: mikayla15
Reviews.Content: The hotel rooms were a little small, the service was good. The location was perfect and in the center of of the city.

Reviews.Title: “One of the Best W Hotels in the Worls”
Reviews.Author: AL1YYZ
Reviews.Content: I am a Starwood Platinum and travel frequently around the world and stay at a lot of W properties and am also a regular business traveler to Montreal. The rooms are large, the location is perfect- near downtown and near Old Montreal. From before my visit with Brigitte's expertise as well as Daniel- the concierge's restaurant reservation recommendations and help- the service is outstanding. I mus say this one of the BEST W properties in the world.

Reviews.Title: “5+ STAR SERVICE At W In Montreal, Quebec”
Reviews.Author: EntoxicatingVisits
Reviews.Content: When all the hotels started to show sold out in Montreal, I knew I was in trouble to get a booking for my upcoming trip. I called to the front desk and was greeted by the very friendly voice of Catherine. She advised me that there was a convention going on and most of the hotels were sold out including the W. However, there are cancellations and it is possible to get a room at a later date if I checked back. Catherine went one step further and said if I left an email address, and a room did become available she can advise of availability in the near future. I left my email address, without much of an expectation. However, a week later, there was an email from Catherine, indicating a room had freed up for the dates I wanted, and to reach back to the W reservations and make a booking asap. Well I jumped on it, and got my reservation for the week. I had an amazing time at the W, and it all started with Catherine going out of her way to assist me in getting a room when the hotels were mostly sold out. I did manage to see Catherine at the front desk during my stay, and she assisted me with any questions I had during my stay, and made it a fabulous stay. Yes the W is a nice hotel, however it was the great service from Catherine that really made it a 5 star stay. I look forward to coming back, and look forward to continued excellence in service.

Reviews.Title: “WOW Experience = Outstanding”
Reviews.Author: KingsPalmSprings
Reviews.Content: I recently spent a long weekend at the Montreal's W. The front desk and general staff were very welcoming,recognizing me as a valued Gold SPG member. When I had an additional request, Concierge Daniel went out of his way to offer me with an immediate solution. My room was clean,supplied constantly with the necessary amenities and elegantly appointed. The second floor lounge was very hip, great table service and surrounded by quite interesting pieces of art. The hotel's location is excellent with the metro across the street and just a short walk to Old Montreal. Yes, I did have a WOW experience on my stay at this property. Many thanks to all of you at the Montreal's W for making my weekend experience an outstanding one. Continue your high standards of service. Alejandro,NYC

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding Trip and Will be Back”
Reviews.Author: Vataha
Reviews.Content: This was our first trip to Montreal as a getaway weekend for our anniversary. The hotel is in an excellent location, within walking distance to Old Montreal, the Underground, Chinatown and the City proper. We stayed in a Fantastic Suite which was very roomy and comfortable. The proximity makes this Hotel ideal for exploring Montreal. I can't say enough about the service the staff of the hotel provides to its guests. I felt they really wanted you to enjoy your stay. The valets, front desk and concierge were very friendly and helpful. I also wanted to thank Francois the Welcome Office Assistant Manager. His attention to detail really made our trip. This stay really was a WOW experience.

Reviews.Title: “Lots of Problems- Very Disappointing- Not like other W Hotels”
Reviews.Author: gatorbait2008
Reviews.Content: I would say I am a fairly easy person to satisfy, but after staying here I feel I was ripped off. The following is a list of problems and areas that this W hotel has issues with. I am from Miami and go to the South Beach W hotel frequently as well as many other W Hotels around the world. This W Hotel is nothing like any other W Hotel. I would have been better off staying at a Holiday Inn in all honesty 1. No Computer access available- there business center was shut down all week for unclear reasons. I do not travel with a laptop so I was wanting to use a computer like most hotels offer. 2. They don't accept US currency at the bars/restaurant etc. This is the only place in Montreal that I have ever come across( and I visit Montreal frequently) that does not take US currencey. It is a major inconvenience for guests. 3. The A/C in the room made a ratting noise non-stop- which made it rather difficult to sleep. 4. The bathroom sink was completely clogged so it would fill up and almost overflow if I didn't shut it off. 5. The Wunderbar which is so publicized, was completely empty on a Friday night- actually at midnight I think there were three other people there. On Saturday night there were a few more people but nothing like other W hotels( I would not stay there for the nightlife aspect- as there are much better bars in town). The staff there was also not the most friendly. and spent the entire time talking to each other( one bartender kept complaining to all the other staff about a guy who was unhappy about a drink she made) They have a very poor beer selection - the St. Ambroise Oatmeal Stout was the only good beer on the menu.. The entire hotel seemed rather empty as well- last weekend in May I thought it would a bit busier. 6. As some others have said the room ( and the rest of the hotel) was extremely dark. Dark to the point of barely being able to see my clothes. The shower as many have also mentioned is poorly designed if you are staying with friends. 7. They charge 2 dollars to make a 1800 phone call each time. Don't make 1800 calls from the room. For the price I paid I would expect much better service than the above. The location is good but besides that I cannot think of one reason to stay here again, especially for the rates they charge for their rooms.

Reviews.Title: “A Winner”
Reviews.Author: Umski
Reviews.Content: Located right between historic and downtown Montreal; this W is a winner be it business or leisure travel. Smart rooms with nice views (road facing) and elegant rooms with no views (rear facing) that come in different sizes. Homely (living room) and welcoming lobby manned by friendly ambassadors and associates makes for a great stay. Restaurant and room service serves great food. Nice bars that are packed on the weekends.

Reviews.Title: “expensive but nice”
Reviews.Author: ottawa006
Reviews.Content: didn't know what to expect, but pleasantly surprised. great spot for special occasion. Nice looking place

Reviews.Title: “Awesome!!”
Reviews.Author: skjelmose
Reviews.Content: wow this hotel is the nicest in Montreal, we have been to W Montreal twice and it is a super modern hotel, the night life in the two bars is great, and the suites are crazy! I have stayed in every type of room in this hotel and they are all modern and sexy. The penthouse suite is beautiful and worth the money, it has very high ceilings, sky lights, in floor tub (which my girl friend loved) and even a large sky light in the bathroom. The spa is great, and the staff are very detailed and remember everything about you. I found the stay above any other!

Reviews.Title: “Great Experience”
Reviews.Author: Boxer_Boston
Reviews.Content: Very nice room in the "perfect" location between downtown and Old Montreal. The Metro can be accessed under the hotel so moving throught the city was very easy. Old Montreal is a short walk from the hotel ... another plus. The staff was very helpful (valets, desk personnel, et. al.) especially Mireille (the Concierge). We have visited the city many times but this was our best experience thanks to the W staff.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: GWNY11
Reviews.Content: The W is a wonderful hotel in the heart of Montreal. It is close to the Old City, and the Metro Station is nearby. The rooms are great, spacious, clean and comfortable. The staff is very attentive, always helpful and cheerful! If my wife and I return to Montreal, we would stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Very trendy hotel with lots of cool features”
Reviews.Author: Rowena53
Reviews.Content: Hotel is very well-located between downtown and Old Montreal. The design is fabulous and every part of the interior looks like an ad from a decor magazine. Second floor lounge is particularly impressive. Rooms are very comfortable with exceptional beds and lots of electronic gadgets. Most impressive was the staff, particulalry the valets who were all well-mannered and extremely efficient. Here are the cons: Open shower setup in the room is totally inappropriate for a family. Hotel should warn guests about this. Rooms are very dark. The low lighting works well in the common areas, but not for the bedrooms. Could use a hot water kettle or coffee machine in the room. We were taking pictures of the second-floor lounge one night and were asked by a bouncer to stop and delete what we had snapped. Excuse me? What's up with that? Parking is a fortune--$31/day. There is a lot a couple of blocks away for $11/day.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel, but staff should check the attitude”
Reviews.Author: CanadaWoman
Reviews.Content: W hotel Montreal is conveniently near the congress centre and close to everything. Hotel rooms are small, cosy but modern. Loved the Bliss products. For almost $400/night regular room rate, you might expect a coffee maker in the room or breakfast included, but it's not. The "bouncers" at the swanky/stylist and hip bar give TONS of attitude turning away HOTEL GUESTS - which is absolutely ridiculous. Expect the kind of attitude you'd expect from a pretentious New York or Toronto night club ...please....get over yourself W Hotel and try to make service enjoyable for your guests.

Reviews.Title: “Superb experience”
Reviews.Author: dfwflier
Reviews.Content: Had a terrific one-night stay at the W Montreal. Love the vibe and decor at this hotel. Staff was very friendly and as an SPG Platinum member, I got a great upgrade to an incredible suite - perhaps the coolest room I've had in all of my travels. Good food and service at the bar at the Otto restaurant for dinner. Will definitely stay here on future trips to Montreal.

Reviews.Title: “Eclectically Eclectic”
Reviews.Author: bospathdoc
Reviews.Content: The service here was excellent. The room was very dark. The window was onto some internal atrium, but the lighting in the room was low with little from this atrium. I went with a friend, so that fact that the bathroom didn't have a door, but a sheer blue curtain, was very awkward for us, even though it would have been romantic with a partner. The gym, SWEAT, was small, with fairly low budget equipment, although it was laid out cutely. The staff was great and the bed was awesome. Overall, I thought the hotel had excellent service and neat amenities, but it was the darkest hotel I've ever stayed in.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice”
Reviews.Author: likestotravel2012
Reviews.Content: We had a short stay here back in November, and overall, thought this hotel was very nice! Definitely a very nice hotel. Pros: Very nice decor, very clean, Bliss bath products, excellent service, Acura service (limited availability though). Cons: bathroom has an interesting setup so if you are sharing a room, make sure it's with someone you are VERY comfortable with, not great value for cost.

Reviews.Title: “Had an amazing experience!”
Reviews.Author: Mikesp1234
Reviews.Content: The staff and service was awesome, and for my wife and I, whom are young, there were 4 bars inside. Great experience!

Reviews.Title: “Beware if you are a light sleeper...”
Reviews.Author: Becksman
Reviews.Content: Usual W Hotel standard. Location is great since it's close to both old and new Montreal. I had a "wonderful" category room and it was a bit to the small side. If you are a light sleeper, make sure you ask for a room far from the Wunder Bar since I could hear music banging till very very late.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Customer Service Right From the Start”
Reviews.Author: Jamborino7
Reviews.Content: My experience at the W hotel was absolutely amazing. The hotel lobby is very modern and inviting and the rooms are absolutely beautiful. Everything in the hotel is combined to create the perfect harmoney of scent, decor and ambiance. When checking in there was a bit of a hold up during check in. I didnt think much of it, but when I got to the room, I got a call from the manager offering a free bottle of wine because of the wait. I thought that was going above and beyond in giving customer service. The second floor lounge is also absolutely amazing. The staff are very friendly and very knowledgable. The drinks were delicious. One of the best hotels I have ever stayed at. Customer service is exceptional!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing hotel!”
Reviews.Author: mariposamg2011
Reviews.Content: I just stayed at the W Montreal hotel and for my first time in the beauitful city, the hotel didn't disappoint. From the moment you step into the hotel, you are surrounded by a very modern, chic, and luxurious atmosphere. The staff are incredibly accomodating and helpful as well. The rooms were exceptionally lovely with an open concept bathroom that was still comfortable. I was not used to having a simple curtain seperate the bed from the bath, but it was oddly refreshing. Nonetheless, the bed was ordained with spectacular pillows and throws and there was also a lounge chair for reading that was not only beautiful but very comfortable. Regarding meals, the food was incredible and spoke of high class, which was a welcome change from 3 star hotels. To add to this, the staff were very attentive to our food and drink needs. The only thing of note was that the hotel is a dimly lit so if that bothers you, it may be something to complain about. However, even this just added to the hotel atmosphere to me. Fantastic place to stay!

Reviews.Title: “W for WOW, Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: emailadam
Reviews.Content: Our trip to Montreal could have started on a sour note. We had elected to drive and arrived in Montreal well ahead of schedule as a storm had never made an appearance. I contacted the hotel at 9am an hour prior to our arrival and informed them of our expected arrival time. Unfortunately our room was not yet ready but they saved the day by kindly upgrading us to a better Suite. The Extreme WOW Suite is wonderful. Its quite large and easily accommodated the two of us. We had been driving through the night to beat the storm and had arrived exhausted. Thanks to their thoughtfulness, feeling rested and refreshed we headed to Europea for a tasting menu and brilliant wines. Upon our return our Valet was kind enough to ask if we were heading out later for the night and informed us he would keep the car in front of the hotel for our departure without being asked. I had bought some Creme Brulee from Gascone and had no spoon but thanks to Whatever/Whenever service we soon found a man at our door with spoons. These are only some of our experiences at the hotel. The attentive staff and the kind maid who wrote us back a kind note for our note was much appreciated. From top to bottom the staff at the W Montreal will do ANYTHING to make your stay very pleasant. It was the team that made the W brand so fantastic an experience. If you have a problem just tell the staff and watch them tackle it whole heartedly.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel stay we have ever had!”
Reviews.Author: nelboski
Reviews.Content: The W Hotel came highly recommended by a colleague of mine. In fact, my colleague actually had a wedding ceremony in this particular W. Everything looked great on the website, but I did not know what to expect upon arrival at the hotel in a city that was new to my fiancee and I... The W Montreal was better than we could have ever imagined or hoped for. The trip to Montreal was an engagement/Christmas gift for my fiancee. How excited were we when we found out that we had received a complimentary upgrade upon arrival? Very excited! From the beautiful lobby leading to our spacious and trendy suite - the first impression could not have been any better! Location is ideal as many destiantions in Old Montreal are within minutes on foot. In fact, we walked everywhere we needed to go during the coldest month of the year. The service is amazing! We had excellent experiences with the front desk staff, concierge staff, Away Spa staff and even the senior managers (who were very accommodating). They truly do appear to want to "make your wishes come true" as they say...I found it never hurts to ask for anything when dealing with these folks! The rooms themselves are spectacular. We stayed in a "Fantastic Suite" which had ample space and many modern amenities that we appreciated (our favourite was the large rainfall shower area). What sets it apart the most I find is the immaculate detail that can be found throughout the place. The use of lighting in particular creates an atmosphere unlike anywhere else. The fitness facility was well equipped with modern equipment (array of cardiovascular machines and range of free weights). The real telling sign of how great this hotel is? Just try leaving. We didn't want to leave the hotel after waking up in the morning because the bed was so comfortable and the shower was incredible...we didn't want to leave to explore downtown too late in the evenings because we couldn't picture a better spot than the chez lounge or the massive bath tub. My fiancee and I have never had an experience quite like this and are eager to return to a W hotel in the near future. Give it a try yourself - you won't be disappointed!

Reviews.Title: “Love the W's”
Reviews.Author: brendonlord
Reviews.Content: Great Hotel, very friendly staff, love the colour scheme which is usual with W Hotels. Location is great, only a short cab ride to downtown and the Hotel gives you unlimited one-way use of a car service. Hotel has a great Vibe, the room had an awesome view of the park across the road. Staff couldn't be friendlier or more helpful. Hotel was extremely clean which again is what you would expect from a W. Would definitely recommend to anyone as I would ALL W Hotels. Was just a shame that the Hotel has no Whirlpool.

Reviews.Title: “Like to 70's on steroids.......”
Reviews.Author: habs4lif6
Reviews.Content: The 70's comment just had to do with the lobby.The rooms are very "chic".The location is great....short walk to Old Montreal and not far from Downtown

Reviews.Title: “Amazing!!”
Reviews.Author: b02102010
Reviews.Content: I travelled to Montreal for the first time and absolutely loved it. When we got to the W the staff were very friendly, they had our bags delivered to our room, showed us how to get to the metro which conveniently was located underneath the hotel. The staff told us of all the restaurants and attractions near by and were very accommodating. The hotel was very up to date and trendy. The beds were the most comfortable I have ever slept in and were very cozy. The location of the hotel is beautiful and is close to everything. The W is amazing and they will be seeing me more often.

Reviews.Title: “Ridiculous! WTF?”
Reviews.Author: artichokehrt
Reviews.Content: I would not recommend this hotel on one factor, the noise. It is absolutely ridiculous that such a high end hotel (with high end prices) does not have the sense to design their facility for quiet sleeping. We stayed on the 5th floor and you could clearly hear and feel the throbbing of the night club below until 3 AM. It also radiated up the elevator shafts. I imagine you would have to be on at least the 7th floor to avoid the noise. I did have earplugs but they did not block out the sound/vibration. It is a shame that the such a beautiful and well located hotel is not able to provide what even the most lowly motel can, a place to sleep in relative quiet. We stayed in a Mega room which was beautiful. I loved the large and comfortable bed. The bathroom was open concept and lovely. The staff were friendly. It met all my requirements in style and convenience but unfortunately that does not make up for no sleep!

Reviews.Title: “Foodies, do not underestimate a good concierge”
Reviews.Author: ciccotown
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I took an off-season weekend trip to Montreal in January. Needless to say, we knew what we were getting ourselves into with the temperature in single digits. I chose the W Hotel based on it's solid reputation and also because they were offering some pretty good deals being, again, that it's January. The Hotel is nicely located near Old Montreal, a five minute walk from Notre Dame, and a short cab ride from just about every other neighborhood. Working in the food industry, our Montreal itinerary consisted mostly around restaurants, eating, and drinking. I had only 1 or 2 places I knew I wanted to visit in advance. 1. The amazing restaurant, Au Pied Du Cochon, and 2, Dieu Du Ciel! Brewpub. With only two solid stops I knew I needed back up. We approached the concierge and asked for advice. My girlfriend are both in our mid-20's. At first glance the Concierge told us all about the club scene, outdoor parties, etc..However, once he found out we were serious about the food scene ( a la reservation at Au Pied Du Cochon I made a month in advance) he pulled out all of the stops. Right away he gave us a LIST of local brewpubs and microbrasseries along with his beer recommendations (all of which were spot on). Followed by a LIST of amazing 'foodie' restaurants. As far as the Hotel itself, exactly what you would expect from the W. Clean, hip, trendy, comfortable. Montreal, in my book, one of the most underrated foodie cities, and that's coming from a resident of the NYC suburbs..

Reviews.Title: “Super high-tech, great service, insane prices”
Reviews.Author: olliedawg
Reviews.Content: Our room was huge, super-clean, well-lit, very cozy. The halls were spotless. We faced the street, but heard not a peep. We received great service from Daniel and Mireille at the concierge desk. The spa folks did a wonderful, but rather expensive, job. Our complaints: Sky-high prices in the restaurant and/or room service, and stupidly high-priced internet service in-room. There are lots of dining options a short walk from the hotel (although, when we were there, it was -18F!), so don't bother. And you can get free wireless service in the lobby.

Reviews.Title: “One of our favorite hotels!”
Reviews.Author: DianaJBJC
Reviews.Content: My husband and I have been coming here for several years--for romantic getaways and when we have business in Montreal. Very hip design, great location near old Montreal, and wonderful staff. Over the years reception, concierge, valets, room service, and housekeeping have always been excellent. Classy, comfortable place. HIghly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Not worth it”
Reviews.Author: stacymac
Reviews.Content: I am writing this from the W and while the rooms are adequate and modernly decorated, the room is incredibly dark. I have a window but it appears I am on the interior of the hotel looking out into office space. The W is one of the many hotels that no longer put a coffee pot in the room, which is incredibly annoying if you are like me and require a cup to get the day started. They do offer coffee in the lobby, but I'm not usually presentable when I want the first morning jolt. My flight was delayed and I arrived after midnight. The appearance of the hotel is really not that of a normal hotel. No drive up, check in area. I drove around the block several times before calling and asking where the main entrance was, it's the appearance of an office building and the valet was nowhere to be seen. It was late, and when they appeared they were very cordial--albeit I was cranky from being late and wishing to get a workout in before bed. I made it to the gym and was sorely dissapointed by what they offer. It's better than most Hilton gyms but offers a few free weights and cardio--not as much as I had hoped for. I am a fit traveler and would gift the gym 2.5 out of five stars. The room does have a DVD player, so I'll use that for my evening workout w/a DVD I brought from my fitness collection. I also went in search of some hot water for tea an hour ago. I found a bar but they said they couldn't help me--I guess they don't have hot water to go ? I went to the front desk, but they were too busy. I called and asked if someone would bring me a pot of hot water, it seems like it should be easier. They said they'd send it up. That was over an hour ago----really tough to find hot water for a cup of tea in this hotel. I really hate it when they don't leave a coffee pot in the room--I probably wouldn't have been driven to type a review otherwise.

Reviews.Title: “Trendy and very well located”
Reviews.Author: MAC_1979
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel, rooms very comfortable. I stayed there few times and tried 3 types of rooms : Wonderful, Mega and Suite WOW. I would recommend the Mega since it's bigger than the Wonderful and has a big bath. I personally do not think the Suite WOW it that much nicer than the Mega, so why pay almost double the price ? The hotel is very well located, walking distance from Old Montreal and Ste-Catherine Street (shopping). Gym is not the best, but you'll find free weights and some cardio machines. It's a bit pricy for Montreal's standard, but overall an excellent choice if you'd like to experience a trendy hotel. We had a massage at the Spa that I would rate 8/10 (100 $ for 60 min). It's on the expensive side, but I liked the fact that you can go back to your room and relax after the massage.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT WEEKEND!!”
Reviews.Author: RPL_13
Reviews.Content: This hotel is excellent. Very highly recommended ! I personally want to thank Catherine F. for all her help and assistance. She was awesome!!!!!!!!! Her help was completely over and above what she needed to do. Thanks for making our weekend special.

Reviews.Title: “W Gave my Engagement Weekend a big hand.”
Reviews.Author: Admiral_Inn
Reviews.Content: The hotel is amazing! Very treny and very cozy. The room itsels was beautiful and was very clean. I imformed the hotel I would be proposing to my fiance that weekend and they did everything I wanted. The hotel is amazing! Just ask for a room away from the elevator.

Reviews.Title: “Very chic and trendy W and location was superb”
Reviews.Author: spgISLANDtraveler
Reviews.Content: Loved this W (I have stayed at many many W's in USA). It was unique in that they kept the lighting low, and accented different areas with chic LED lighting on the walls. Main color is an electric blue throughout hotel, on front of hotel, in rooms the piping/curtains matches the same bright electric blue, and it continues even in the hallways. Very modern touch, and it gives a fashion forward feel to the place. Rooms were spacious, white leather benches, white bedding (platform bed), huge washroom space with separate shower, bath, and restroom. Well laid out with closet space and large desk area. WunderBar Club was packed at night and very good music. Gets busy around 11pm. Was expensive to drink there so be prepared for that. All in all great location and can't wait to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “The W Montreal is a "must stay" when in Montreal.”
Reviews.Author: anniealpine
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located around the corner from the Convention Center and up the Street from Old Montreal with all its shopping and restaurants. It's a short walk to St. Catherine Street. The service, friendliness, decor, food and beverage and comfort of this hotel makes it a gem in a wonderful city.

Reviews.Title: “All Style, No Substance”
Reviews.Author: dharmapunk77
Reviews.Content: The W Montreal offers the height of superficial comfort. To the naked eye, the place looks amazing--all modern design, minimalist decor, and unique ascetic touches. It doesn't take long, however, to realize this place has virtually no functionality. It may LOOK appealing (or at least interesting), but it's not exactly a cushy home-away-from-home by any stretch of the imagination. The lobby--misleadingly referred to by the oh-so-comfy moniker "The Living Room" in all W literature--is a dark, strangely-arranged cavern that, like the rest of the building, defies the simple logic of functional space. Not only is it oddly laid out, but the whole oblong room is kinda creepy. I fully expected to see bats swooping down. And be aware that there is a nightclub--an ear-splittingly loud, bass-pumping, techno music nightmare kind of nightclub--right in the heart of The Living Room (don't all living rooms have nightclubs?). You must pass this club every time you want to get to the elevators, which means, at the appointed partying hours, the place is a maze of clubbers gathered around a velvet rope in the middle of The Living Room, making actually getting to your room quite an ordeal. The room itself, like the rest of the building, is bizarrely designed with no thought to practical, logical, daily use. I booked a Wonderful Room (their wording, not mine), which is the size of a glorified walk-in closet. We had a view of the interior hallway across the atrium. (So far, pretty "wonderful," huh?) There is no bathtub in the bathroom, just a shower with a wall made entirely of glass, which faces the entire Wonderful Room, which means you shower with an audience. The bed, while moderately comfortable, is unusually small, especially considering the price of the room; it barely sleeps two people. While it doesn't say so in the W literature, this room is clearly designed for one person--unless you like to watch your loved ones shower and sleep virtually on top of one another. Which I don't. On the second night of our two-night stay, our entire floor seemed to have been taken over by clubbers from the nightclub downstairs. It was a nonstop party on the ninth floor, with endless noise and drunken revelry. After a series of phone calls to the front desk, the issue was finally resolved...hours (and much lost sleep) later. Now don't get me wrong, the employees of the W Montreal aren't impractical like the hotel in which they work. In fact, the employees are the only reason I didn't give this hotel a "terrible" rating. While they aren't an outright, smiley-kind-of-friendly (which, let's face it, can be annoying), they know how to give good customer service, and that's all I care about. Every time I called the front desk about the noise on our floor, I honestly got the feeling that the person on the other end cared and was committed to doing something about it. It may have taken awhile to get resolved, but that has less to do with the W Montreal staff and everything to do with the disrespectful oafs with whom I was unfortunate enough to share the ninth floor. And just as an added note, there was an exceptionally friendly (and very cute) doorman, whose name I unfortunately did not get (there's nothing as gauche as nametags at the W), who went out of his way to be friendly and helpful to us. Thank you, Mystery Doorman. The most frustrating thing about our W Montreal experience, however, was the cost of the weekend. Now, I'm no pinch-penny, and I'm happy to spend good money on a luxury hotel--as long as that luxury is provided. And with the exception of decent customer service, there was nothing luxurious about our stay at the W. In fact, the entire W experience is designed to milk as much money out of you as possible. As another reviewer pointed out, there is a price-tag on practically everything in the room. Wireless internet access is unusually expensive. Phone calls are expensive--even toll-free numbers incur high charges. Parking is expensive (tip: park in the civic center parking garage just behind the W; it's a fraction of the price, much more convenient, and just as safe and secure). And room service--forget about it. On our first morning at the W, it was snowing very hard (which I didn't know till I actually went outside because our room had no exterior-facing windows or natural light--how "wonderful"), so I ordered a pot of coffee and two orders of toast to be brought to the room. I knew it would be expensive, but I had no idea HOW expensive until I saw the bill. $37 for a pot of black coffee and two pieces of dry toast! Everything at the W Montreal not only has a price-tag, but surcharges and "administrative fees" are tacked on as well. Be very, very wary. I was honestly scared to utilize the ice bucket or use the shampoo in the peekaboo shower because I thought I would be charged. This is not an unreasonable assumption to make considering two nights at the W Montreal, when it was all said and done, cost nearly $600. As I mentioned earlier, I'm no miser when it comes to traveling, but if I pay that kind of money for two nights at a hotel, I want a little something in return. Sadly, I didn't receive anything in return at the W Montreal. Next time we'll stay at the Sofitel, where we know that with the big price-tag comes big luxury. But if style over substance is your thing, then the W Montreal is definitely for you.

Reviews.Title: “Wow”
Reviews.Author: AliceOlive
Reviews.Content: This is one of W's best hotels. Mod decor, generous rooms, high ceilings and excellent staff. A great location for Montreal - within walking distance of everything. I'll be back.

Reviews.Title: “nice location, and staff; but about that bathroom and club”
Reviews.Author: COtrips
Reviews.Content: I don't know how to feel about this hotel. On one hand the location is great, the rooms are solid size, beds are "heavenly", staff is friendly and accommodating, and Max at the concierge is very helpful. On the other hand, the bathroom is a disaster. Do i start with the clear blue wall of glass separating the cavernous shower from the room, the terrible lighting from either above or below, the shower head 15 ft above, the shower itself being cold because of the huge space it's in, or the drywall flaking from behind the shower head due to poor plumbing?? Or, music from le club bumping well into the night, which i could hear on floor 6? It' just odd...i don't know how else to put it. I would stay there and decide for yourself.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: m3lissa083
Reviews.Content: We had great time that night! We wanted to celebrate that I am pregnant and Joena St-Amour gave us a wonderfull room! Thanks

Reviews.Title: “Luxury stay in a beautiful city!”
Reviews.Author: ChowChow79
Reviews.Content: My stay at the W hotel was one of the best stays I have ever had anywhere! The rooms are magnificent and the staff were friendly and always helpful. My room was always cleaned to perfection right down the the bliss bath products! As an SPG member, I was invited for evening cocktails and appies on my last night and it was a very nice way to start my night!! Whenever I find myself in beautiful Montreal, you can be assured that I will be staying at the W hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Stylish hotel but service wasn't great and there were lots of added costs”
Reviews.Author: ed1
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for one night in November. The hotel is beautifully styled and very quirky. However check-in took about 15 minutes, and there was no apology for the wait. My room was lovely, but dark as the blinds were down (because the view was basically the other side of the atrium and there wouldnt have been much privacy had they been up). The decor was fabulous, and the bathroom and shower amazing. I was a bit disappointed at having to pay $6 for a bottle of water in the room and being reminded by stickers on everything (CD, bathrobe, books etc) what these would cost if removed, I am not in the habit of doing that and think it is a little insulting. Breakfast the following morning was good and service at breakfast was good, athough checkout again took time. I also gave some postcards in for mailing and was charged $2.50. When I got home I saw that the cost of postage was only $1.75 - only .75c, but added to the feeling I was being ripped off at every opportunity.

Reviews.Title: “Best experience!”
Reviews.Author: miy0
Reviews.Content: The hotel very well located, the rooms are amazing! Staying at the W made our trip a lot better!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Hospitality”
Reviews.Author: funnygoose08
Reviews.Content: My Husband and I stayed here on our honeymoon, it was beautiful and romantic. When they discovered we were on our honeymoon, they sent up choc covered strawberries and wine. During our trip I became really sick with Pnemonia and they arranged for Tea to be sent up to our room, free of charge and when I had to be taken to hospital they arranged the ride and made sure my husband was comfortable after I was admitted. I would go back here in a Heart beat, or to ANY W hotel in the world.

Reviews.Title: “Big rooms, easy stay”
Reviews.Author: BJGtraveler
Reviews.Content: Good location and large, clean, trendy rooms. Room service did not send what I wanted at first, but quickly corrected the order.

Reviews.Title: “Fun hotel/room”
Reviews.Author: deppypung
Reviews.Content: I really enjoyed our stay at W- the rooms were fun, the hotel was intriguing from the moment we walked in and the staff were very helpful. The only thing that I found 'different' was the glass wall of the shower that looks into the room- it was a different experience not having privacy in the shower!!! Overall a great experience!!

Reviews.Title: “It doesn't get any better than the W Montreal!”
Reviews.Author: neteng12314
Reviews.Content: It goes without saying that the WOW suite was amazing and all the amenities from the view, to the loft bedroom, to the balcony, were exceptional! Weâ€™ve stayed in 4 different W Hotels but I have to say Montreal W is by far our favorite. Every time weâ€™ve stayed at your hotel I am most impressed by the impeccable service that is delivered in a friendly and approachable manner, like Daniel and Mireille who were a pleasure to meet or the bartender who recommends the perfect drink after asking a few questions but equally impressive is the person who is vacuuming the floor in the hallway and stops to press the elevator button and then asks about our day and offers a pleasant greeting. So thank you again from both of us for a perfect celebration of our 25th wedding anniversary.

Reviews.Title: “Unforgettable.”
Reviews.Author: DMAC32
Reviews.Content: I decided to stay at The W based on everyone's reviews on this site - and I'm glad I did. There were 10 of us girls traveling from Toronto for my bachelorette and it was a perfect. We took advantage of "the Acura" service and booked the car on Saturday so they could drop us off at Holts, we went to the spa and it was fabulous. I booked the Fantastic Suite for my sister and I and it was perfect for pre-drinks with the girls since it had a separate sitting area. The only negative thing that happened was my sister used the wireless internet in the lobby and told it was free then had the computer open in the room and we got charged for $2o so that was kind of annoying. All in all, a great trip + hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great property... spectacular staff!”
Reviews.Author: iGuyInTheCity
Reviews.Content: Friends and I stayed at the W Montreal and had an amazing time. The lobby and rooms are beautiful but the staff is what was really spectacular. The associate who checked us in was pleasant, welcoming, and professional. She arranged to have our luggage stored as our room was not ready and directed us to the concierge for dining suggestions. The concierge took wonderful care of us for the weekend. He listened to our interests and was right on point in his suggestions for restaurants and activities. He was also funny and charming - and took the time to address our needs without making us feel rushed. At checkout, the associate worked with us to address an errant charge on the bill. She quickly resolved the issue and was friendly and witty as well. I definitely recommend this property to Montreal travelers!

Reviews.Title: “Great service, better location.”
Reviews.Author: PaulandNadene
Reviews.Content: Beautifully styled hotel. We enjoyed our stay at W this past weekend. It was a short and enjoyable walk to both the shopping on Sainte Catherines as well as the water front and old Montreal. The service was perfect, from a surprise room upgrade to having a spare contact lens case when we forgot ours at home. I'd recommend this hotel if you're looking for a getaway in Montreal.

Reviews.Title: “Simply Amazing”
Reviews.Author: nancy12988
Reviews.Content: Stayed here early September weekend and had an amazing time. Traveled here with family and the minute we walked into the hotel for check-in, we were greeted with warm smiles. We were SPG members and when we booked on the phone we had reserve for a king size bed bc they did not have any queens available anymore even though we had a total of 4 people. During check-in we had mention if there were any queen size rooms available and we were upgraded to the 10th floor to the mega room. The curtains in the room were blue and loved the interior design! The room was very spacious and even had bliss spa products! We used the whatever,whenever button on the phone and the service was so quick. The staff literally came within 5 mins to bring any products/services you would like. The gym in the hotel was very clean and had quite a few work out machines. The only downfall is that they don't have a swimming pool. Checked out the bars in the hotel as well, got very packed and is trendy. But I would say drinks on St. Catherine would probably be cheaper, but it'll be a different vibe. The location of the hotel was fabulous...within walking distance to Chinatown, downtown, and all the sight seeing. The parking was pretty expensive. It was about $35 for valet parking with in/out privileges. We were able to find street parking at night, but would have to move the car sometimes around 9am. But by then we were going to other places already so it didn't really make a difference. EVen though check out was at 11am, we were granted late check out even till 1pm! We had a wonderful time here. Thank you W Montreal for making such a pleasant stay for us.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great service, ammenities okay”
Reviews.Author: Rachael073
Reviews.Content: Great location - short walk to St. Catherine (shopping area) and short walk to old city lobby - ok but not wonderful; we figured we'd spend hours down there playing on the iPad and hanging out, but it wasn't that nice bars - good bar selection; nice to hang out at at night room - it was fine but nothing wonderful; a little small gym - passable but nothing terrific - about 4 treadmills, some free weights, and a universal gym in the basement we stayed at Hotel Le Germain a few years ago and the rooms were much more luxurious (its near St. Catherine but far from the Old City)

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Great Staff!”
Reviews.Author: momof3monkeys2
Reviews.Content: My sister and I stayed in this hotel for 3 nights in the beginning of October. It is in a really great location, within walking distance to Old Montreal, Chinatown, Shopping District, and the Arts District. Even if you didn't feel like walking, plenty of metro, or cabs. The staff was very friendly, the concierge was exceptionally helpful. However, if you are not comfortable with staying somewhere very trendy, this hotel may not be for you. I found the room we stayed in very odd. There was actually no bathroom door, just a curtain, which proved a little challenging from a privacy persepctive. Also, there was this great big shower with a shower head stuck in the corner, so you were also stuck in the corner. Also, the hotel restaurant was way over priced, as you would expect, and it is a shame, because there are so many well priced places to eat in the vicinity. There was also a stagette in the room beside us that kept my sister and I up for most of the night, even after 3 phone calls. So, what I am trying to say is, if you are looking for peace and quiet, maybe don't go to this hotel, but if you are looking to be on the "scene", then defintely stay here!

Reviews.Title: “Whatever, whenever!”
Reviews.Author: vinder_sodhi
Reviews.Content: I've been staying at the W in Montreal for 2 years now during the work week, and I can't say enough about this hotel and it's staff. The design of the hotel and the rooms are great - modern but with a focus on comfort (although the rooms can be a little dark if you are working). The staff is fantastic: super friendly and helpful. The level of service is consistently excellent - whether it's the friendly check-in (Joena is wonderful), the valets always having my car ready at 7:30 each morning, the concierge having great suggestions for restaurants (along with getting us reservations), everyone is very helpful and always have a smile on their face. The bars are also pretty great; the plateau lounge is a nice spot for having a few cocktails after work (try the old cuban), and wunderbar gets busy on wednesday nights. Restaurant Otto also serves up some delicious modern italian cuisine, it's pricy but worth it. I'd recommend this hotel in a heartbeat to anyone visiting Montreal - it's in a great location, caters to many crowds, and offers excellent service.

Reviews.Title: “amazing experience”
Reviews.Author: Michael S
Reviews.Content: When we checked in Doreen took care of us and was very personable and friendly. She put us in a great room and was very engaging. The rooms were very clean comfortable and the associates were all very friendly. On checkout Catherine made sure we were taken care of and arranged for a taxi to the airport. She was very personable and caring.

Reviews.Title: “Very original, and good service.”
Reviews.Author: bjouve
Reviews.Content: Stayed 2 nights in "fantastic suite". The staff was helpful and friendly all along my stay, just like always in Quebec! Location is very good, steps away from Ste Catherine, the harbour and the old center. The room was very confortable and original, with the bath tub in the middle! Finally, I recommand the Otto restaurant both for breakfast and dinner. Only backdran of this hotel: no pool and no lounge!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic anniversary weekend at the W Montreal”
Reviews.Author: ErinHAbe79
Reviews.Content: Had an amazing anniversary weekend at the W Hotel in Montreal! When I made the reservation and told them it was our anniversary, we were upgraded to a Fantatic Suite, which was really beyond gorgeous. Had its own sitting area, open bathroom plan, deep soaking tub, etc. The room decor was fun and trendy and it was sparklingly clean. We also enjoyed in-room massages and brought our own wine, which was really fun and romantic. Concierge made great walking tour and restaurant recommendations. Staff was lovely and very accomodating. Great restaurants and nightclub in the hotel too, if you enjoy that. Only criticism is that the fitness center could have more machines/weights. its very basic. We often stay in W Hotels around the world when we travel, but this was one of our favorites (along with the W Hotel in Istanbul). thanks.

Reviews.Title: “A great night away”
Reviews.Author: iamben
Reviews.Content: What can I say other than Thank You to Francois and Hugo. We arrived very late into the evening and found a line up around the block to go to the Kill Magazine party. The valet rushed to take the car and usher us passed the throngs of people waiting to get in. Hugo greeted us with a warm smile and told my wife that sadly there were no chocolate covered fruits, and no upgrade was available. A casual wink told me that he and Francois made sure to make our stay more than wonderful, but fantastic as we were upgraded to a beautiful suite with an amazing view. Upon opening the door, a plate of chocolate covered strawberries greeted my wife. We stopped for a quick drink at the party, as all hotel guests get to go to the cool people parties, and then adjourned to our room for parts of the night where the details are none of your business. Waking up much too early (weâ€™re on baby time), we had breakfast at Otto around 7:30AM. Amazing waffles and scrambled eggs later, we returned back to our regularly scheduled lives. Hugo wished us well, the valet put some bottled water in the car and we were on our way. We will be goign back at least one more time this year

Reviews.Title: “Loved the W Montreal”
Reviews.Author: Ruby_NYC_10
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed and enjoyed our experience at the W. Our room was clean, we loved the decor and the staff was great. We also thought the restuarant was very good.

Reviews.Title: “Trendy hotel - great for young people looking to party”
Reviews.Author: allprima
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed in this hotel for Labor Day weekend. We stayed in a Fantastic Suite, which was nice, but not spectacular. The hotel and room has a very overall modern, minimalist vibe, (not plush) and is very dimly lit. (see pictures I have attached). The room was decently clean and very comfortable to sleep in - we were on 9th floor and didnt hear any noise from the club whatsoever (although we were usually in the club until it closed lol). We were lucky enough to get use of the free Acura service to take us to dinner on Friday night, which was a nice perk. The one downside to this hotel is the location. It is a decent walk up a steep hill to get to the main street (St. Catherine) and we usually just took a cab because it was quicker (especially when I was in heels!) If you are looking to stay right in the middle of the action, I would recommend the Loews Hotel Vogue instead. On the plus side, this hotel did have a pretty good club off the lobby which was convenient if you like to party. The service was very good and everyone at the hotel from valet to concierge was very helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Hotel, a Destination in Itself!”
Reviews.Author: kevnrico
Reviews.Content: What a wonderful hotel! First of all, the accommodations are perfect and the overall design of the hotel, flawless. It feels like the best layouts in your favorite interior design magazine! The rooms were ample and almost sexy! Very clever bathroom designs, with little luxurious details! Most importantly, the staff were friendly and professional! Our front desk agent, Joena, was quick, generous and very helpful! Also, the doorman Alex, was not only a warm and genial ambassador for the hotel, but almost a concierge for the city! I can't imagine that we would have had as much fun without the staffs insightful suggestions. The hotel is a hotspot, and the buzz generated by the hotels nightclub and events only helped to foster that sense of excitement and fabulousness! The floors and our rooms were very quiet and relaxing. We can't wait to come back and will be returning next month! (we really had a great time!) Sincerely, E. Gomez

Reviews.Title: “Worth the price”
Reviews.Author: expatsing
Reviews.Content: I find hotels in Montreal are expensive. Some well known brands give you a high price tag, but the experience is just not up to your expectations. I have hesitated to book at the W because of the price... I decided to give it a try. Well I am so happy I did it! I finally found the hotel I will stay in when in Montreal after trying a few.
