The hotel is trendy, and the rooms are just so nice. Spacious, with everything you need. The staff were happy to provide my special requests with a smile. The staff is very courteous and I was happy to get served in my French Canadian language, which sometimes lack in Montreal I must admit. The night life in the hotel is young indeed, not for me, but that`s not the reason why I stayed there. The location is great with alot of nice restaurants around. The gym is ok, and the restaurant is good too....

Reviews.Title: “Don't go if you are over 25!”
Reviews.Author: ZoomerinTo
Reviews.Content: The hotel turns into a club after dark and the lobby and elevators are swarmed by kids in black with an attitude, which is matched by the hotel staff. It's loud, annoying and not for Zoomers. Save this for the kids.

Reviews.Title: “Unique, Trendy, Funky Hotel. But, thats it.”
Reviews.Author: SoloSpaGirl
Reviews.Content: W Hotels are always nice looking. I didn't think the staff was as friendly as they should have been. I gave the valet guy $5.00 just to grab a bag out of my car that I forgot after he parked car. (I thought it was easier for him to do that then drive car back and forth). How about I waited almost 10 minutes, he didn't come back. I went to away spa for a facial, mani and pedi. I was not impressed. But, the therapist was very sweet. The cocktail waitress was rude. I guess this review is done. I would recommend this hotel to friends just because the actual hotel was funky and a cool place to visit, staff can always be changed.

Reviews.Title: “WOW!”
Reviews.Author: nancyq222
Reviews.Content: I travel and stay in Hotels alone many, many nights per year. The staff at the W Hotel were welcoming and made me feel safe and comfortable in the hotel. They appeared to care about their jobs and my well being which is very important to busy business travellers. Great decor and fun atmosphere. Most importantly, the friendliest staff! This Hotel would definitely give you a fabulous Montreal experience and is within walking distance of shopping if that is your "thing".

Reviews.Title: “Best W Hotel Experience”
Reviews.Author: mcarey5543
Reviews.Content: Great Hotel, Outstanding Friendly Service, Hip, great bar scene....the best W in North America.

Reviews.Title: “Montreal luxury”
Reviews.Author: gazzathom40
Reviews.Content: Great hotel with superb staff and service. Room stunning and well equipped. Only negative was no tea/coffee making facilities in the room - recommend bringing your own unless you want to get dressed and go downstairs for your early morning cuppa.

Reviews.Title: “simply the best experience ever”
Reviews.Author: mrgyles
Reviews.Content: from the moment we walked into this hotel ... we were greeted with a very warm smile and very friendly caring front desk staff. our booking was made by Catherine .f, upon check in i briefly meet Catherine. she was very professional and caring.. halfway during my stay, she called my room to double check if my wife and i was doing fine... what service..Catherine for prime minister please.thank you W Hotel for this pleasant experience .i know i will be back with my family some time soon.

Reviews.Title: “Oustanding”
Reviews.Author: newcastle056
Reviews.Content: The hotel and staff are at the top of their game when it comes to customer service. Ashley and Teresa are worth the visit to the hotel spa as they are superior in providing customer service and advising you of the best options. We were happy and relaxed by the time we left the hotel to return to Northern Ontario. I would stay their every time. You can get some excellent rates and discounts online when booking rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Chappaqua3
Reviews.Content: Second time we have stayed at the W Montreal. Hard to believe we were able to use Starpoints and cash to stay at this wonderful property. Wonderful location on the edge of Old Montreal. Decor is minimalist. Our Mega room had a huge bathroom area with a rainshower hotel. Great beds as well. There was a problem with TV and within minutes the tech person was in our room setting up a brand new TV because the first one wouldn't work. I left a pillow in the hotel. The staff located the pillow and Fedexed it to my next location.They were very helpful and a pleasure to deal with. We belong to Club Intrawest and visit Montreal before we go to Tremblant. The W is definitely my # ! choice in Montreal.

Reviews.Title: “Girls' Trip”
Reviews.Author: rebeccagold
Reviews.Content: Our trip to the Montreal was amazing. The W Hotel rooms were gorgeous, clean and very spacious. The staff more than accommodating, whenever you left the hotel, you were greeted by the adorable and helpful bellboys. They had bottles of water for all the guests as they came and went, which was a nice touch. Most importantly, the concierge, Daniel, was the best! He sent us to the most incredible restaurants, arranged our transportation and was so fun and personable. The W Hotel is lucky to have him! Also, every good hotel has a good hotel bar and the Plateau bar rocked, awesome bartenders and delish drinks!!! Thanks to all the staff for a wonderful stay, I will always stay at W Hotels after this experience.

Reviews.Title: “W onderful”
Reviews.Author: scairney1
Reviews.Content: We visited your wonderful hotel last week for our anniversary and were treated to a wonderful experience. Everything was great, your staff especially Julie at the front desk, the room, dinner and the folks helping out at the entrance. We thank you very much and look forward to returning soon.

Reviews.Title: “W - the best hotel in Montreal”
Reviews.Author: mellylec
Reviews.Content: The W hotel in Montreal is by far our favourite hotel in Montreal. Not only because its a beautiful and contemporary hotel but mostly because of the amazing service that we get at your hotel. We were there recently and once again we were truly please with the service and the attention to details of the hotel staff. We were served by Joena at the reception and she really gave us an amazing service. She made sure that our experience at the W hotel was memorable.

Reviews.Title: “excellent hotel.”
Reviews.Author: rosely_10
Reviews.Content: i really recommend this hotel. the staff was so amazing.. the best hotel in montreal!

Reviews.Title: “HOW CAN YOU RELAX WITH THE NOISE”
Reviews.Author: manvinder
Reviews.Content: how is one to relax with the bass pumping music from the club. we booked in advance and made it clear that we wanted the wow factor (as they say) but what we got was loud music till 3 am and no help from staff they dont care its not there problem. furthermore never stayed at a hotel with a prcie on every thing in the room. it's like a mastercard ad....toilet paper $6, water $6 in room magazine $4

Reviews.Title: “Wonderfull room, chic and modern. Was...”
Reviews.Author: Dodih
Reviews.Content: Wonderfull room, chic and modern. Was given an upgrade on check in being an SPG member. My only concerne was the small size of the queen bed and the room feeling very dark.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous!!!”
Reviews.Author: Deanna9
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the W for one night (wish we had longer!!) in a "Mega" room. Beautiful view over the park, huge room and bathroom. Everyone we came across during our stay was extremely friendly, from the front desk, bartenders, concierge,etc. It is in a wonderful location between the Old Town of Montreal and the downtown area. We walked everywhere with no problems and no worries about safety. Free wireless internet in lobby and great workout area. We did go to the Wunderbar for a couple drinks and the ambience is great. We were early (10:30 and the first ones there!) and had a lovely couch in the corner to relax with our cocktails. I would definitely stay here next time I'm in Montreal!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice but wouldnt stay again”
Reviews.Author: euphoriagirl
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at this hotel July 17th-26th. The Hotel was really nice, clean and in a great location. It was only about 5 blocks to old town and the entrance to the metro right in the front of hotel . I recommend you get a pass to use the metro for a week its much cheaper and great to get around in the city. The staff at the hotel was great, friendly and helpful. The only staff that wasnt to friendly were the guys that work at the front of the hotel at night that guard the door to the wonderbar. They were intimidating and not nice. Its annoying when you want to come in the hotel at night and their blocking your way. You greet them and they dont even respond. There were a few things I didnt like one the shower, there was no privacy and the water pressure was weak. There is no free wireless and the internet service is outrageous, I payed over 100 bucks for 6 days of service. I never odered room service it was just way tooo expensive for example a sandwich would be 25 dollars plus service charge of 5 dollars and they add 18% grautity do the math. You could spend that much on lunch for two people at a cafe down the street from there. The restaurants were way to expensive also, we never ate at any of them. Spa services were also outrageous. I have stayed at many 5 star hotels where room service and restaurants are more reasonable. I dont consider this hotel a five star, Id give it 4 stars. Oh and you can forget about taking anything from the minibar. Water bottle $6 beer domestic $10. Go to the grocery store and buy your own drinks. For the price of what the hotel charges stay at the Westin or St. James. Now what I did like about the hotel was the cleanliness and their staff. The front desk, the bell hops and the room attendant were always very nice and courteous. Always had smiles on their faces and would help you with anything you needed. The bed was really comfortable and had nice clean sheets. I think the next time I come to Montreal I will stay at a bed and breakfast inn close to old town where we did spend alot of our time.

Reviews.Title: “The Best Hotel Experience”
Reviews.Author: Poprocksss
Reviews.Content: The W was the best hotel experience for us ever. We were booked for the King Wonderful Room with a view of the Park but when we checked in, the lady at the front desk was so pleasant and automatically upgraded us to the Fantastic Suite as we were there for our anniversay. The Manager heard this and offered us each a complimentary drink at their Bartini Bar. The room was outstanding, all open concept with the tub and the shower facing the bedroom which you can draw curtains around. The hotel has valet parking only for $30 but the valet driver told us that we could park at a public garage for $20, there are also other private parking lots for less in the area. We didn't have dinner at the W but instead went a restaurant/bar called KOKO. Only a $9 dollar cab ride but such a beautiful contemporary atmoshere, well worth it. The W also has a beautiful lounge/bar and a club for dancing if you are interested. We highly recommend this hotel due to great service and atmoshere.

Reviews.Title: “W Montreal was the best travel...”
Reviews.Author: akaszowski
Reviews.Content: W Montreal was the best travel hospitality experience I have ever experienced. From the moment I walked in the door I didn't just feel at home (as many hotels make you feel). Rather I felt like a movie star being offered celebrity treatment. I felt special - and it was the staff who made that happen. My receptionist Olga was professional and helpful. She immediately informed me that, much to my delight, I had been upgraded to the Park View room. She called 5 minutes after I arrived in my room (surprise) to ask if everything was to my liking. The room exceeded my expectations and then some. Muriele the concierge was helpful and very knowledgeable about Montreal's best sights - and the map she provided was indispensable. I also felt taken care of as I explored the fine city - she provided her business card with the instruction that I could simply call at any point if I needed assistance while out and about. The nightlife, music, atmosphere, bar drinks were all outstanding. Again, I felt like a celebrity in such a special and exciting venue. On the next day after I checked out, I left my baggage and explored the city. When I returned before catching my train I thought it would be nice to freshen up. Receptionist Johanna offered me a room in the spa (with a shower!) to use... what a nice added touch! I left the W for my train refreshed and stylish, and ready for my return. To me, the W Montreal wasn't only my hotel. Even after I checked out... it was my travel base - the place where I felt connected and cared for... and where I was made to feel truly special. Like a star visiting an exciting and delightful city. I couldn't be happier with all that your team did for me.

Reviews.Title: “The only words: superb”
Reviews.Author: JakeKGeorgeville
Reviews.Content: A special occasion led to our stay and from the first moments of checking in, the service was beyond impeccable.The receptionist,Cathy,was exceptional in her supportive efforts to see the stay go without a hitch.By calling the hotel phone number...only that... we were able to set the stage for a wonderful stay, including having the CD player turned on so that entry into our room was particularly eventful. And, on leaving, finding we had left behind some articles of clothing, a call to Cathy brought the response: "well, I'll bring it to your home when I get off today". And she did. Superb!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: Monnalisa44
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our stay!! The exceptional service began with the unloading of the luggage and it never stopped! My daughter did not want to leave. I look forward to returning.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Time, we were WoWed!”
Reviews.Author: Jalenkos
Reviews.Content: This was my 3rd stay at the W Montreal. Came down for a guys weekend and we had a blast. Its nice that it is right between Old and New Montreal so its a short walk to both. The hotel is funky, modern, hip and young feeling. Very much enjoyed the bar on the second level. Only bad part was they don't let you take your drink over to the Blue Room. I could stand there for hours and people watch everyone coming in and going out of the club downstairs. If you like extremely loud bass that club is for you...not really my thing so I was quite content to hang out upstairs. Got a WoW suite. It was quite nice since it had the balcony. Was fun just hanging outside enjoying the warm weather! If going in the winter I actually would prefer the Fantastic Suite though as they seem to have a little functional space (and the Fantastic Suite has a huge tub, which the WoW does not). The service was fantastic, from the valets to the consierge to the waiters. Overall this won't be the last time I visit the W! Look forward to my next stay!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel and outstanding service!!!”
Reviews.Author: LucieF68
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel during a conference at the Palais des Congres (one block away). I must say that I was absolutely delighted with my stay at W! The hotel, spa and my room were all beautiful. However, most importantly, the service was impeccable on ALL fronts: the ladies at the check-in desk, the concierge, the bellhops, the cleaning and maintenance staff, and the staff at the spa. In general, I tend to be really disappointed by the level of service offered at similarly-priced hotels during my travels throughout the year. At W, it was not only that the staff did NOT make any mistakes (e.g. misunderstood requests, missing dry cleaning, not dealing with raised issues, displaying apathy/rudeness, etc. etc). It was much more than that. Every single employee that I encountered was engaged, sociable, helpful and totally effective at doing their job (and beyond). Every hotel can boast a small handful of great employees but I was honestly blown away by the consistency of my experience over the 5 days. I felt cared for and in good hands, which is EXACTLY what the hospitality industry is all about. BRAVO!!!! I look forward to returning on my next trip to Montreal. Unfortunately, you may have set the bar so high that I am destined for disappointment when I have to stay elsewhere!

Reviews.Title: “One of the best hotel in Montreal”
Reviews.Author: djpreach
Reviews.Content: Super clean, very comfortable, not so expensive. Everything is just fantastic; perfect location, amazing food and seriously well designed rooms. I loved it every times!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing hip & groovy rooms”
Reviews.Author: WorldWanderer77
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful experience at this stylish and trendy W hotel in Montreal. Very nicely done, with very nicely designed & decorated rooms. Definitely a modern vibe. Concierge was very useful in terms of dining & entertainment recommendations. Great location. The club is very noisy and loud, and we could hear the music in our 6th floor room on Friday & Saturday nights - so plan accordingly :) Very comfy beds, great service. Parking is $20+ / night in the lot across the street that they recommend... While it's expensive, it's better than getting your windows smashed - especially if you're from out-of-province. Lots of smash & grabs unfortunately - our car was broken into on a previous trip to Montreal, so we parked in an underground lot this time.

Reviews.Title: “definitely for the younger set”
Reviews.Author: winsumwzl
Reviews.Content: We spent 3 nights at the W in Montreal (Wednesday-Saturday). We took the train from Quebec City and arrived at the station, took a cab to the W, which is only a few minutes away. First impression was that this is NOT like other Westins. We are Starwood Preferred members, and chose this place for its location, which was very good; however, the property is definitely geared to the younger set (maybe teens to twenties, thirties) except for the prices, which are still pretty high ($6 for a bottle of water in the room, $40 for a very modest in-room breakfast). The decor is very modern, but kind of cheap-looking. They have a very trendy bar and we had to pass 3-5 large bouncers dressed in black to get into the hotel every night. Additionally, at night, the music was so loud, we weren't able to talk until we got into the elevators and the doors closed. We stayed in room 915, which was nice, but had a large glass shower which made up one wall of the room, this meant that anyone in the room had a front row seat to watch you wash. It was weird, unless you enjoy that kind of thing. Also, their signage and slogans were flippant and to my mind, somewhat tasteless. Everything was full of innuendo, even their email survey form titled "How was it for you?" All that being said, the location was nice for walking everywhere, and the concierge and staff were very friendly and helpful (and young--didn't see anyone over 30). Also, they use Bliss products, which I love, and really comfy beds. Not at all like the luxurious Westins we've stayed at in other places, but perfectly fine for younger folks looking for a hip place who are not too particular about level of finish and amenities. We would probably not stay here again because we prefer a bit more posh and polish, music at lower decibels and privacy in the shower.

Reviews.Title: “W---AOU!”
Reviews.Author: Rikipok
Reviews.Content: What a good idea we had to book a WAOU suite for 2 nights there! Gigantesque room on 2 floors, shower facing the ilving room (quite disturbing at first) but taking a shower and watching TV at the same time: WAOU We had a small terasse so we invited some friends to have Champagne and cupcakes with a view of the city center...priceless. The lobby and bars are very cosy and chic I will definetelygo back there!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel near Convention Center”
Reviews.Author: ccgworldtraveler
Reviews.Content: My stay at this W was a good one. Next door to the Convention Center which was very convenient. Connects via underground passage too on those rainy or warm days. Room was nice. Air conditioning was reliable, unlike other properties, on such hot and humid days. Front desk staff was polite and helpful. If you need an umbrella, get those from the front desk - they are not large umbrellas though. And make sure you return them to the front desk as they place a deposit on your room while you are borrowing it. Room was open plan - loft-like. The bathroom opens out into the bedroom area and only divider was a curtain you pull across. not ideal unless u r with a lover or partner. Lighting in the room seemed inadequate - kind of dark, especially in the bathroom. Wifi available. Included in room safe as well as iron and ironing board. only complaints are about the food and bar - food from room service was TERRIBLE and I couldnt even eat it. On top of that, it wasnt even hot. How can you mess up a burger and fries? Well they did. I also ordered light food with drinks at the outside bar - again, really a let down. Something bad is going on in their kitchens. I would eat elsewhere off property if I were you. Plenty of places nearby anyway in the old city as well as chinatown.

Reviews.Title: “Very funky and fun hotel. slightly let down by the noise”
Reviews.Author: Jtung74
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the W at Montreal for one night during June. Among all the big chain hotels, I always prefer Starwood and Hyatt and this quirky W at Montreal did not disappoint. Location: Right on Square Victoria near the World Trade Centre and main railway station. Despite being at a more commercial area, itâ€™s a short walk to the shopping street, old town and to Rue de St Catherine. Montreal is a very small city and this hotel serves as a good base. Room: Paid extra to upgrade from Wonderful room to a Mega Room. The room was of decent size, with a big bathroom room (very deep tub and big rainshower). Well stocked bathroom with Bliss amenities and very functional. There was a big flat screen TV, DVD player, super king size bed and all the typical W goodies (excellent bed linen, good mattress, soft pillow, etc). The only downside was the chargeable wifi. Public Area Very funky lobby and bar area (Plateau and Wonderbar). Probably the coolest place to spend the evening in town. Plenty of sofa in the lobby and upper ground floor. Service: Prior to arrival I received few email to confirm reservation, notify weather, etc. Very personal touch. Most staff members were very friendly and helpful. They always have time and energy to chat to the guests. Among all the lady who helped me to store my luggage and the chief at concierge impressed me the most. Even some staff off duty were very helpful and chatty. Definitely the â€œWhatever/wheneverâ€� attitude as advertised. CONS: The only issue during my stay was the noise level. The room was well insulated and you cannot hear the street noise at all (the windows canâ€™t be opened). However as I had a room on the 4th floor facing the Victoria Square, right above the trendy Wonderbar, the room was very noisy and literally you can feel the vibration from the loud music from late evening until early morning (2-3 am). If you enjoy partying this will be no problem but as I tend to go to bed early and was staying for only one night, this was a bit annoying. Overall this is an excellent hotel. I would definitely stay here again if I return to Montreal, and next time I would either join the crowd at Wonderbar until morning hour, or request a quiet room in advance.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel lousy service”
Reviews.Author: Joe_petr
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this hotel on several occasions nothing bad to say about this hotel except when i booked i booked for 4 days and they kicked me out on the 3rd day how this can happen i do not no hotel is great very trendy and cool nice rooms clean big fun to go and party there but they said that i had only reserved to 3 days and wouldnt budge so thats when i found the hotel crystal and been staying there ever since. The food was not good at all at the w either room service was very pricey and the quality was not good at all

Reviews.Title: “Montreal W is a Winner”
Reviews.Author: FrankBillingsley
Reviews.Content: Usual W amenities....fabulous decor, bar is the scene to be seen, ultra-friendly staff. Location is terrific, you can elevator down to the metro from the lobby, concierge service impeccable, restaurant food excellent and bar service top notch. Housekeeping never bothered us until we were ready to be bothered, the room was unbelieveably quiet (don't ask me how they do that), and the shower.....well.....you will remember the shower for many vacations to come, mon ami. Abientot!

Reviews.Title: “PERFECT location, service, interior design, comfort and friendliness”
Reviews.Author: LovetoLiveWell
Reviews.Content: My 17 and 21 year old daughter and I traveled to Montreal from NYC for 3 days/2 nights for Memorial Day, and the W was perfect! I love to travel and my daughters have had some great experiences, too - each major city in Europe, London, Caribbean (Anguilla), Aspen, LA, Hawaii, Safari in Botswana, Cape Twon, etc - and we laugh at how we travel coach but stay at great hotels. The W was endlessly professional, friendly, spotlessly clean, always helpful, and amazingly comfortable. It is the first time we looked forward to that great time between a long day and late dinner to NAP! NO question or request was too much, and each person answered the phone fast, delivered quickly, responded nicely, and provided us with constant enjoyment and comfort. The concierge (Daniel) even traveled 20 minutes away and back when I realized I left my Canadian money in an envelope in a store -- 2 hours before we needed to leave for the airport to go home!! I do NOT as a general rule bother to rave -- good or bad -- on sites, but the W is your best bet for Montreal - or anywhere (anytime).

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel and Staff - Thanks Alex!”
Reviews.Author: Musicfan_NS
Reviews.Content: My new place to stay in Montreal! Everything was fantastic and the staff and Management really care about their guests. I had such a good conversation about music with Alex (a great ambassador for W) that I almost missed getting to the airport on time LOL. You just can't go wrong booking in at W. PS Alex - thanks for the great music fan chat and the world class service - you guys at the W rock!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful”
Reviews.Author: meleetyme
Reviews.Content: The hotel is beautiful and is located in a very convenient location. The staff was very attentive and the room was large and beautiful. The decoartions are a bit dark and masculine and there is no door to the general bathroom area which is not ideal when you are traveling with a group of people. Hence I found the room more hospitable to a solo traveler or couple. The breakfast was a little disappointing but that would be the only negative that I would cast upon this hotel. The on site bar scene is great for good music, drinks and meeting new people.

Reviews.Title: “One of my favorite hotels in the world”
Reviews.Author: pantheist861
Reviews.Content: I can't say enough good things about the W Montreal - it's the kind of hotel that you would expect to see opening on the Moon in 2050. The vibe is electric, the rooms spacious and sexy, the staff always ready for action. You walk through the front door and you can quickly tell you're going to be the envy of every hotel-dweller you know. When it comes to actual practicality, they win you over by being located right on a Metro stop - the warmest way to get around town on a cold winter night - as well as a couple blocks from Vieux MontrÃ©al and reasonably close to a lot of amazing restaurants/attractions. The room furnishings are stunning (especially if you get a suite upgrade): an open glass shower, huge tub with two sinks, nice big TV with lounge chair, a work desk, sexy side tables with built-in glow lamps, and of course a seriously comfy bed with faux-mink throw. Man, what a place. One word of caution: unless you happen to be wealthy, an SPG member with points or you actually work for SPG, it's going to be trÃ©s expensive. A couple rounds at the bar or a quick meal downstairs will set you back quite a bit. Luckily, the SPG points rate here is really cheap so this is the place for which I save them!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel -- Easily the best W Hotel that I've ever stayed at”
Reviews.Author: ScudderLosAngeles
Reviews.Content: From check-in to check-out, the W Montreal surpassed my expectations. Having just flown cross-country, the staff recognized that I was exhausted and quickly checked me in even though I had never stayed there before. The hotel manager personally welcomed me and upgraded my room. The room itself was stunning. Modern. Clean. Rain shower. Great windows with views of the Montreal skyline. All the amenities that you would expect or want, including very fast wifi. In fact, it was so comfortable I decided to stay in, order room service, and watch a movie. Room service itself was quick, and the food was quite good as well as healthy. I also spent some time in the uber-cool bar. The hotel is definitely trendy and the lobby itself is a bit of a scene. A good contrast to the quiet room. As a frequent traveler and someone who's stayed at many W hotels (San Diego, San Francisco, Chicago, Mexico City), the W Montreal stands out. The room seemed like new and had more luxe fixtures and furniture than the average W, and the staff quickly learned my name and made me feel at home. As for negatives, I actually don't have any. (If you look at the other review I've posted, I don't hold my tongue when a hotel fails to impress). The hotel is great for anyone who wants a cool, modern hotel but with top-notch service. (During this same trip, I also stayed at the Opus Hotel, which I liked and which is also fun, trendy and modern. However, it is a tier below the W Montreal).

Reviews.Title: “I would stay there every weekend!!!!”
Reviews.Author: lam0n
Reviews.Content: The W Montreal is simply the best, the staff and service are great and the hotel is so chic .... great for any event or even for a romantic weekend. Some of the best sleep you'll ever get in the amazing heavenly bed .....

Reviews.Title: “Very hip”
Reviews.Author: withkidstravel
Reviews.Content: The W is a very hip, dark hotel. Clean, well laid out, large rooms, but so cool that it is sometimes more style than substance. The dark atmosphere is great, except that it is so dark in the elevator you can't read your room number on the envelope after check in. The bathroom is open to the room, with a shower curtain to be pulled for privacy. Maybe not a place to come with the family. Huge room, well-appointed. It is great for a solo or couple, but the emphasis is on style, sometimes over function.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent experience provided by great service”
Reviews.Author: clarkjor
Reviews.Content: I was traveling with a group of guys for a quick weekend trip. None of us had ever been here and we relied heavily on the concierge. Mireille at the concierge desk took great care of us and recommended some fabulous bars and restaurants for us to visit. The rooms were very comfortable and trendy. We all had a great experience and would recommend this hotel to any traveler.

Reviews.Title: “Sort of Made Up for the Ash Cloud”
Reviews.Author: Zollipop
Reviews.Content: I got waylaid in Montreal by the ash cloud on my way to Europe - while I wasn't happy about it, the W Montreal helped soothe my disappointment. It's stylishly decorated, staffed with sweet and good looking people, it smells good, and it's located centrally with a subway stop right outside the door. The customer service was absolutely superb. The hotel's restaurant Otto is quite good, but there are definitely better restaurants in Monreal. W Montreal is absolutely worth the money.

Reviews.Title: “Very very nice.”
Reviews.Author: shappych
Reviews.Content: Was at this W for 3 nights for a business trip. And I have no 'real 'complaints...very contemporary, very clean, great bed, personable service. I just happen to hate the shower: straight-down orientation of an over-sized showerhead: makes washing long hair surprisingly annoying. Had a couple meals at Otto, which was pretty good. Convenient to trains. Would return.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic experience!!”
Reviews.Author: travelforfungreece
Reviews.Content: I stayed in W Montreal for 4 days and i enjoyed every moment. Every person that works there is very friendly and happy to satisfy all your needs! The guys in the concierge are cool!! Trust without second thought their recommendations! The breakfast is Ã¡ la carte and it is delicious. The eggs benedict is a must! The room i was staying was spacious but there were not a lot of storage places like big wardrobe and drawers. Its location is ideal for tourists, as it is very close to Old Montreal (and the old port) and to the downtown.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect vacation”
Reviews.Author: born4hotels
Reviews.Content: This hotel made it happen. Fantastic suite was awesome, plenty of room to stretch out. Location is close to bars, restaurants, and tourist attractions. Metro is directly in front of hotel. Staff was awesome. Probably the friendliest W staff I've ever seen. If I went back to Montreal I would definately stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “A little too trendy”
Reviews.Author: Scott1734
Reviews.Content: While the W is known to be trendy, this hotel was a little too trendy for me. The bathroom opens into the bedroom and there is only a curtain separating the tub., shower and bed. This is fine solo but suboptimal if traveling with a family. When getting a room make sure that you are far from the elevators and on a high floor or else your room will hear the noise from the club until 3 AM. Also, avoid using the complementary acura service. This service was run the worst at any of the W hotels I have stayed in. If you need advice on what to do in town, talk to Hugo at the front desk. His suggestions are solid and not as pretentious as the concierge.

Reviews.Title: “Cool hotel, but maybe too much”
Reviews.Author: Frank21961
Reviews.Content: This is a really cool hotel, but it can also feel cold at times. The rooms are spacious and very well furnished in a modern style. The food at Otto restaurant was amazing! The hotel is a bit out of the way from the downtown core. Service is without reproach.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous”
Reviews.Author: zzcola
Reviews.Content: Great location, beautiful rooms, attentive staff. Would stay there or any W in a minute! The spa was wonderful and the Concierge top notch!

Reviews.Title: “Truly Wonderful Experience!”
Reviews.Author: 1PAULIE10
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I recently stayed at your hotel on Valentine's weekend. It was our first time at The W Hotel and it definetaly will NOT be our last! The room was better than we imagined and the hotel was beautiful. Hugo at the front desk was very welcoming and friendly and Francis always greeted us with a smile, from the concierge to the doorman the entire staff was fantastic! We will find it very difficult to stay at any other hotel because the other hotels pale in comparision. Thank you so much for a wonderful stay and a fabulous experience! A&A

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Experience”
Reviews.Author: Canuckgal25
Reviews.Content: I had the pleasure of staying in the W post wedding for a few nights. It was super sheek, great location, and very clean. The staff are always there to help you with anything you need. They have they're own SUV, and they arranged to take us to a happening restaurant in the heart of Old Montreal. It's pretty pricey....at $500 a night for an almost basic room, but well worth it. I recommend you bring your own wine, munchies, and water....because the fully stocked fridge is so over priced. The hotel itself has a really great sit down bar, and a yummy restaurant attached from the outside. It's about a 10 minute walk to Old Montreal. Overall it was a perfect stay and I would definately go back again!!

Reviews.Title: “Is there an alternative in Montreal?”
Reviews.Author: georgerr
Reviews.Content: Well, what shall I say, there are so many pleasant details to this Hotel... It's the fourth time that I was in W Montreal and I tried several other locations in Montreal before. As long as they offer a vacant room for me, I'll stay to the W. What I like? The rooms are really nice, the service is extraordinary, they have a concierge desk that deserves the name concierge desk: Mireille an Daniel know everything about what's going on in Montreal The restaurants can be recommended, the bars too (though I'd love to have them reduced the volume of the music at least a little bit ;-) conversation is hardly possible)

Reviews.Title: “Uber cool hotel but nothing is perfect.”
Reviews.Author: Linda X
Reviews.Content: We love this hotel, LOVE it. If you plan to shop downtown be prepared for a 10-15 minute taxi ride and it does get expensive. 5 minutes from the train station you can walk on a warm day. The lounges, bars, lobby are all gorgeous and relaxing. Rooms are modern and crisp and clean with an open concept decor. BUT, before you check in make sure you ask for a room with enough windows to see out of. This is not just for the view - this is so you can find your handbag! Seriously our room was so dark in the day time we spent too much time looking for things. I had stayed in a room previous with ample lighting so I know they are available. Be careful with internet too as they charge you. That is absolutely ridiculous. The staff is super friendly and helpful. One day the television went down all through the hotel when we were there and it remained that way a whole day. I would stay there again because it does feel like home but I would insist on a different room.

Reviews.Title: “W Montreal”
Reviews.Author: brigmondm
Reviews.Content: Great Hotel Location and service was second to none

Reviews.Title: “Super Fab!”
Reviews.Author: TravelGuruToronto
Reviews.Content: We (myself and 2 girl friends) didn't stay over night but we did indulge in the Away Spa and Wunderbar both located in the hotel. The Away Spa was amazing! From the welcome greeting, to the serene services/treatments to the tea and pampering, we will definitely be back. The Essential Facial is highly recommended. Wunderbar.....WOW!!!!! Ultra fabulous, beautiful people, phenomenal DJ/music...what else can I say. Bottle service is reasonable and convenient, staff is friendly and accommodating and the vibe untouchable. LOVED this hotel!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Wow... they messed up”
Reviews.Author: flyingdutchman06
Reviews.Content: I love W hotels, they're edgy and designy and cool. However, this one will go down in history as my worst W experience. First the good news: the hotel's location is very good. Literally minutes from the Old Town, and next to a metro station. Furthermore, I was upgraded to a wonderful room (506), with a bath, walk in shower and view of Victoria Square. Very fancy, and two out of three nights I had no complaints until the nightclub Wunderbar kicked off on my last night. I was on the fifth floor, but felt as if I was smack in the middle of the dance floor! As the noise didn't stop at 2 AM, I called down to find an apologetic receptionist offering to ask the club owner to lower the bass, and send up some earplugs. Unfortunately that didn't work - turns out only rooms near the elevators are bothered by it. So at 0230 I was moved to another room on the 9th floor, which did help, for the three hours that I had left of that night. When checking out, I again brought up the noise. It seems the costs of soundproofing the elevator shafts were too hefty for this property (according to the receptionist). And on my question why they didn't warn me beforehand, he said that they never knew who was bothered by the noise in advance,... even suggesting that the fact that I was a 'light sleeper' compounded the problem. Apart from apologies, the hotel didn't offer me anything out of their own initiative. I had to bring up that I didn't want to pay full price for that night. The receptionist, who did remain friendly to his credit, had to sort it out with his manager- who didn't even bother to show herself to apologize and offer me the 50% discount (which I did get). Very disappointing experience for a hotel of this caliber and price range. I would expect nothing but gracious apologies, followed by a swift discount and a personal send off by the manager on duty. If you can't handle complaints - you don't deserve praise. One other tip: be careful with the wifi in your room. They charge you per IP-address, apparently. So if you use your iPhone and your laptop to go online, they expect you to pay the same fee twice. It was sorted out in the end, but not after the receptionist affirmed that they would normally be two charges - which doesn't make sense, since they charge you for internet in the room. Shouldn't matter how many appliances you use. Cocktails at the bar are very good, food at Otto's is lackluster yet expensive, and certainly doesn't meet the expectations raised by its website. So, in all. Nice hotel, don't expect too much friendliness in case something goes wrong, worth a try if you can get a good deal and ask for a room away from the elevators.

Reviews.Title: “Well...”
Reviews.Author: BarryWE
Reviews.Content: The location is great, the hotel is well, a W. If you dig that vibe (modern) you will dig this hotel. The staff were very friendly and helpful. The room was comfortable. Was originally booked on the fifth floor which was fine for Tuesday and ok for Wednesday but the weekend started Thursday night so I asked to be moved since it sounded like the band downstairs was in the room next door. Got moved to the sixth floor facing the street which was much quieter. My advice would be to ask for a room facing the street as high as possible if you are a light sleeper like me. Other than that it's a W, and I can dig it.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, good location, great service”
Reviews.Author: HHuisman
Reviews.Content: My company has got a special rate for the W Montreal and since I am platiunum member at SPG got an upgrade to a better room. I had a large room with was very trendy (as like the rest of the hotel), with all the standard stuff. Compliments for the concierge which did a lot of extra things for us! Also, you should try and book the hotel car! They will bring you to any restaurant within normal distance of the hotel. The gym is not that great, and doesn't really has got the same vibe as the hotel. Although all the required equipment is available, so no problem really.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Service, great rooms and great location. What else can you ask for”
Reviews.Author: mikeh613
Reviews.Content: I have had the pleasure of staying at the W montreal a few times in the last year. Out of the five W's I've stayed at, the service I've received in Montreal is always phenomenal, the W times square could learn a thing or two from them,. During my last stay while I was checking in, the welcome ambassador noticed I thirty and bought me water bottle without asking, it was greatly appreciated. I was given a very large "mega room", which was very modern, interesting open-concept design and very comfortable. In the room we found a hand written welcome note from Genevieve, a manager personally welcoming me to the hotel and not to hesitate to ask if there's anything I need "whatever you want.. when ever you want it". I had a problem at first making my reservation but Genevieve set it right instantly and even sent up some fruit and bottled water to the room which was a great surprise for me and my guest., I felt like this manager was personally monitoring my stay throughout the reservation to making sure everything was right, she is a real asset to the hotel. A+ Customer service. In the morning I was running a bit late checking out and asked for an extra 2 hours and to my surprise the front desk replied "not a problem, as a gold member your automatically entitled to a late check out". They made it sound so easy but 8 out of 10 times I find it very difficult to receive many of the SPG gold benefits but the W montreal recognizes status and tries it's best to make sure you enjoy your stay! While checking out, I asked Josianne at the front desk walking directions to the train depot, she explained the directions me to as well as offered the "Acura service by W" to drive me there. She radioed the drive and within seconds my bags were in the trunk and we were off to the station!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent 5 star hotel”
Reviews.Author: MISSPICO
Reviews.Content: This hotel is fabulous .I love the security that is strict in the hotel , the clubs and restaurants and decor are amazing , its trendy and hip , classy and comfortable. The rooms are a bit more expensive but its worth it , I loved how when I'm in the elevator and my key card doesn't work someone jumps in the elevator to fix the situation immediately before i have to even become frustrated having to go to the front desk and wait in line to get a new card.The only thing that i noticed was missing was a pool . in a 5 star id expect a pool , but perhaps they are working on that :) Would still stay there again and would love to try out w hotels across the world because they are all unique and beautiful from the research i have done :) there is nothing embarrassing about this hotel , you will be happy to be picked up outside of it eat inside party and have a business meeting in the room if necessary , anything you like , its very great , classsy and business orientated.

Reviews.Title: “Great service,amazing style”
Reviews.Author: tlog
Reviews.Content: I was in Montreal during a bit of a cold spell. I have to say that the W hotel exceeded my expectations. The lobby /entry area was under refurbishment however from the moment I set foot off the curb from the taxi I experienced wonderful service and quality of accommodation. I requested a king with a view and I got it ! the room was perfect for my stay. I wanted to make a trip to Quebec City and the concierge was so informative and helpful ,including finding a less expensive way to travel , making reservations, etc. I would absolutely recommend this hotel !

Reviews.Title: “Bathroom - tragically HIP”
Reviews.Author: Seven_Continents
Reviews.Content: Was here for three nights and have mostly good things to say. Location is typical downtown Montreal, easy walk to the Old port, shopping etc. The staff could not have been nicer, not a bit of attitude from anyone. I took advantage of a $20 upgrade from wonderful to guaranteed park view Mega and since the weather was miserable we were glad to have the windows with something to look at and check the weather. Amenities were great, room was clean and everything worked. Minibar was very well stocked although overpriced as for any hotel of this calibre. My bit of luxury is a shower room rather than a bathtub with a shower curtain and the W certainly did not disappoint. My only pet peeve is the open bathroom, literally being part of the room with only a curtain. This also included a cut out in the wall so as you walk in to the room you also look directly into the bathroom. They had the same thing at a Luxury Collection property in CA and I didn't like it there either. Maybe I'm not hip enough to like it but I'll keep my showering and shaving habits to myself, thanks. The hotel bar was fine. I would definately recommend the hotel as a whole, but the new Westin around the corner might beckon those who would find the bathroom disconcerting.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: jennrose17
Reviews.Content: Great service, friendly staff, clean and impeccable rooms. I will definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Friendliest people I met in Montreal, treated me like a princess.”
Reviews.Author: jenidallas
Reviews.Content: I had a one night stay here in August 2009 for business. I don't speak a bit of French and was frankly finding Quebec to be very intimidating. Thank goodness the W staff salvaged that. From the smiling valet to the accomodating front desk staff to amazing bar staff, everyone was amazing. The valet chatted with me and made a few restaurant recommendations for lunch. The front desk staff found me a cozy place to work since my room was not yet ready. But the true gem of the W, the reason I will rave about the place is Paul, the friendly bartender at Bartini who shared so many insights about Montreal and made great suggestions for the remainder of my stay. The rooms are interesting - I am SPG Platinum and was upgrade to a lovely suite. The bathroom is exposed to the entire room so not somewhere to stay with someone you aren't extremely comfortable having see/hear everything! There is also an odd window in the bathroom that looks directly into the corridor of a law firm in the building next door. Privacy is definitely a sacrifice for such a dramatic room!

Reviews.Title: “Unbelievable service made for an incredible vacation”
Reviews.Author: citieslover
Reviews.Content: I have traveled to many four-and-five star hotels in cities through North America and Europe - and have not seen service anywhere that is so complete and so effortless as at the W Montreal. My boyfriend and I enjoyed W hotels and were looking forward to a break at a chic hotel. We were not expecting the two-level upgrade we received to a gorgeous and romantic Mega-Room. We did book during the week but they could have as easily placed us in a standard room. Since the weather was freezing, we wound up staying in the room more than expected. Our calls downstairs for wine and other amenities were immediate, a forgotten personal item was provided with a smile - and when our car was brought from the valet parking, the doormen didn't merely go through the motions but chatted animatedly about our trip as they handed us waters for our trip. All of the service was, typical of W hotels, excellent - but what made the difference was the authenticity of interaction from all of the staff.

Reviews.Title: “A Wonderful long-term stay!!”
Reviews.Author: Marc09Paris
Reviews.Content: My 50+ nights at the W Montreal were wonderful! Professional, generous and polite, the staff was superb and kept the place alive. They always made me feel welcome. I would like to thank a few by name: Paul Ielovcich at Bartini Bar who had some great stories and helped me out on occasions, FranÃ§ois Patulli who made sure that my needs were answered, Mireille Kostopoulos and Daniel Mireault, at the Concierge desk, who went out of there way to ensure that my whims outside of the hotel were satisfied. In the spirit of keeping my review balanced and also making the W Montreal a better place, I would encourage the Starwood hotel group to refurbish the rooms that are suffering from some wear and tear. Otto, the restaurant, could use better management.

Reviews.Title: “I said WOW many times during my stay”
Reviews.Author: ZP83
Reviews.Content: I came to the W Montreal with my very close friend from Jordan for my birthday and wanted to make it special and stay at a good hotel. We got in a little late to Montreal, but not to worry our room was not given away and the staff put us in a spectacular room (HUGE). The thing I love about the W's are that they are modern yet warm and the staff made it extremely welcoming at this particular W. The Whatever Whenever service was spotless! Everything we asked for was promptly done with a fantastic attitude. The hotel was within walking distance to many of the local attraction and to the fabulous shopping. My friend and I wanted to get a good sandwich (having gone to college near Manhattan) one that would compare to the Carnegie Deli in New York (I know I know its one of the hardest places to beat for a sandwich). The hotel recommended that we went to the famous deli called Schwartz. It was just what we wanted great food at a reasonable price and was sort of like Canada's version of the New York Jewish Deli's. As for the night life all we had to do was press an elevator button and we were in cool surroundings at the W's bar and never had to wait in line to get in. This was the perfect get away, I wished my stay was longer at the W.

Reviews.Title: “The W Hotel, Montreal is the greatest hotel ever!!”
Reviews.Author: bethspittler
Reviews.Content: The location, the rooms, the spa and especially the people are absolutely fabulous! Did I mention FranÃ§ois the W Insider?? WOW! He always goes the extra mile to make sure I have everything I need. Every time Iâ€™m there, I have a very positive and relaxing experience. The W Montreal is the best hotel Iâ€™ve ever stayed in!

Reviews.Title: “Best Party”
Reviews.Author: mel49
Reviews.Content: I live in montreal and chose the W hotel to celebrate my boyfriends 25th bday. Stayed in a WOW suite, had 18 ppl show up. The staff allowed me to come a week early to check everything out. Had everything I needed the day of. Worked out so well, everyone had such a great time. Plus the room was gorgeous. As well as, the Wundar Bar is amazing saturday nights!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay, extremely "WOW'd"”
Reviews.Author: spgplat2
Reviews.Content: I decided to take a one night trip up to Montreal after staying in Vermont over Thanksgiving and had a fabulous stay at the W. Upon checking in, I was upgraded to the Extreme WOW suite and it was amazing. Bose surround sound, espresso machine, dining table, living room, huge balcony, 20 foot glass walls, 1.5 bathrooms. It was fabulous and I really appreciated the upgrade. Even as a platinum starwood member, very few places will upgrade you to the nicest suites, so it was very nice of them to do it on my cash and points rate. PROS The location was great and we were able to walk all around Old Montreal to see the sites. I highly recommend the Notre Dame Basillica, it was maybe a 5-10 minute walk from the Hotel. The train station is also really close as is the Montreal subway. The staff was really great. The hotel was extremely clean and everyone we asked for help was extremely accomodating. We ordered room service for dinner, and it arrived very promptly and the food was delicious. The upgrade to the suite was great, and when out room wasn't ready, we were given two free cocktails at the bar which was a nice gesture. The restaurant was superb. We had lunch their upon arrival and the food and service were excellent. The meals were around $25 per person which included an appetizer. CONS The internet didn't work the first day we were there and we had to wait for our room until 5pm. WIth the upgrade I didn't mind as much, but this might be annoying if you had to wait this long for the room actually booked. The workout room was kind of small compared to some other non-NYC Ws, but it still had a couple ellipticals and treadmills and a small free weight area. Other than that our stay was perfect and I will definitely return to this hotel on my next trip to Montreal.

Reviews.Title: “Ultra Trendy”
Reviews.Author: zataco
Reviews.Content: Very chic! Very trendy and lots of fun. The only drawback was the high price tag that goes with ultra modern chic!

Reviews.Title: “Definitive "cool" hotel”
Reviews.Author: dlee7077497
Reviews.Content: If you're looking for a place to stay in Montreal that's close to "everything", and is a little different from your traditional hotel, this is it. Located on the edge of old Montreal, but within walking distance of Place Bonaventure, gare Centrale (train station), the Bell Centre, rue Sherbourne, etc. The decor is "cool"; think modern trip-hop European with dramatic muted lighting, square edges, light sculptures. Rooms are large enough, with flat screen TVs and DVD players, and "see-through" showers (something you either enjoy or not...!) Service is impeccable, and the bar is a place to see, and be seen.

Reviews.Title: “Simply Superb !!!”
Reviews.Author: EntoxicatingVisits
Reviews.Content: As a person who stays in hotels about 40 times a year, I am able to compare and constrast the best and worst many hotels have to offer. The W Montreal ranks as an exceptional hotel - why ? Yes the LOCATION is ideal, close to some of the best bars, restaurants, architectural buildings. Yes the ATMOSPHERE in the lobby, elevators, hallways is fresh with modern elegance and class, setting just the right mood for any evening. What seperates it from the rest is the simply AMAZING and thoughtfull STAFF. The bartini is a must visit. Sou at Bartini is not only able to pour you the most sinful of drinks your taste buds may desire, but she will provide you the personal attention and warmth that you always expect, and rarely receive. Sou is one example of what makes individuals like myself continuously return to the W, again and again. Hence the amazing personal attention, location, and atmosphere, can make any visit to the W Montreal, a treat for all your senses. Can't wait to go back.

Reviews.Title: “Home away from Home”
Reviews.Author: CaliforniaBoy99
Reviews.Content: I am a frequent business traveler that stays at the W Montreal maybe one or two times per month usually for a few days on each stay. I find the hotel to be centrally located and one of the more enjoyable stops on my business in Montreal. The rooms are quite nice and the W Montreal is one of the few hotels that have windows that can be opened to allow fresh air in to supplement the central air which I find sometimes stale. The beds are quite very comfortable and allow for a great nightâ€™s sleep. The business center is tiny and in an enclosed room that gets quite warm. Not a plus at a hotel like this. The fitness center is convenient and has equipment to allow you to have a good workout. The bars at the hotel are quite good and diverse and afford a different setting and experience depending on your mood. Bartini on the first level is small and quaint and allows the "Cheers" experience so to speak. The Plateau Lounge on the second floor is great to relax, chat, maybe people watch but also a great spot to grab a drink with colleagues after work. The other bright spot at the hotel is the staff. Obviously travelling frequently to the hotel has allowed me to get to know the various staff and I have nothing but high praise for their professionalism and commitment to service. The Doorman are always polite and offer a hand. The front staff, what can I say. I feel like I am at home. Arriving after a long flight and being greeted by name and asked how my trip was etc. is always pleasant and appreciated. CatherineL in particular always finds a way to make me and my fellow business travelers stay at the hotel just that more special. Overall, I have had the opportunity to stay at other business hotels in Montreal but I find the W to be both stylish and hip while affording a level of business professionalism that is well complimented. The other hotels are nice but are often staid. I highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “They are the BEST!”
Reviews.Author: Five_stars_hotel
Reviews.Content: I am a regular guest of this hotel and I can say that they are the best!! The service is excellent! Each and every employee is willing to help, they smile and they take the time to make sure that everything is perfect for you! The decor is gorgeous and the ambiance is very cool! You get the wow factor! The hotel is very clean and they pay attention to details! The location is perfect, you can walk to go everywhere and you have direct access to the subway! If you go to the Wunderbar or Plateau Bar make sure your try "a la rose" this is my favourite cocktail!! It is incredible! The breakfast at Otto is very good too! I am a "hard to please customer" so... if I say this hotel is perfect it is because it is perfect :-) I always stay at luxury hotels and this hotel is the definition of luxury! Have a nice stay!

Reviews.Title: “Service at the W was, hmmm, Wonderful. Thank you Catherine L.”
Reviews.Author: Absolut007
Reviews.Content: Private, special, wonderful, I had a great weekend planned for me and my partner. Without Catherine Lesperance, the hotel services manager, I believe, it could not have been so special. Catherine went out of her way to make sure the room had extra special, delicate touches of perfection. Both of us are so pleased to have stayed, so welcome in our own city, a home away from home. Thanks, Catherine. Thank you W!

Reviews.Title: “Well treated and exceptionally well taken care of!”
Reviews.Author: jockboxer
Reviews.Content: My wife and I completed a 3 night stay at W Hotel Montreal and we loved the hotel accomodations, facilities and staff. This was our second visit to W Montreal, our first being 5 years ago when the hotel was newly opened. What a refreshing change from our first visit!!! The staff were very friendly and welcoming (Katherine at the front desk), we were offered an upgrade to a suite which was very nicely appointed, spacious and extremely comfortable. We very much enjoyed the convenient location of the hotel, walking distance to shopping, metro and restaurants. Bartini is a nice stop on your way out for the evening. We would highly recommend this hotel

Reviews.Title: “W Montreal- Top Notch”
Reviews.Author: tribecab
Reviews.Content: I travel to Monreal frequently and have experienced most of the Starwood properties in the city. The W Montreal is, by far, my favorite. From the moment I walk in the door, the energetic and friendly front desk staff always greet me by name (Catherine is the best!) and make sure my stay is going well. I always think it is a nice touch when a hotel calls right after you go to your room to make sure everything is okay. All staff at the hotel- from the doormen to concierge are top notch and they have been so consistently for the last two years of traveling there. From my experience, it is always a sign of a good hotel management when they can keep good staff. The location is ideal- in between downtown and the Old Port and right on Square Victoria. The W is a nice getaway from your run-of-the mill business hotel and I highly recommend it- for either business or pleasure.

Reviews.Title: “Worthwhile”
Reviews.Author: chaniagrace
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the W Hotel in Montreal this past weekend. We booked a king but wehn we checked in they had us in a queen. I asked for that to be corrected and they had no problem with that other than it would be 45 minutes (closer to 1 /12 hrs). In the meantime they sent us to "Bartini" for complimentary drinks. Here we chatted with Dani who filled us in a bit about the "W" philosophy. It was a bit too long a wait, but we were in no rush. Our luggage was to be in our room, but we had to call down and then it still took a while so we got it ourselves as we wanted to dress to go out. The room was really lovely. SPOTLESS. In fact the whole place is. Not a fingerprint on any mirror, glass or surface anywhere. Impeccably clean. Nicely appointed. I have a thing about those horrible polyester hotel bedspreads, so picked the W as it mentioned duvets on their room amenities list. The bed was extremely comfy with feather bed, down pillows etc. Loved the oversized velvet chaise for reading and the turquoise tafetta drapery. Very quiet. I found the valets to be really helpful and the staff pleasant but not too kissy-poo. Did not like the 18% surcharge on room service on top of the $5.00 delivery. Internet in hotel like this should be complimentary as should a coffee maker in room. It is those little things that make the difference when I select a hotel. Dont mind paying for a cup when I have time to wake up and make myself presentable. The peek-a-boo shower was no big deal, there is a shower curtain you can pull for privacy for the toilet. As other reviewers noted , it is a young crowd, but it did not feel like a party hotel at all. We are almost 50 and did not feel like the old timers. Great lounge and lobby to people watch. From a design standpoint, it is beautifully done and definitely feels special. I really enjoyed it.

Reviews.Title: “W stands for Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: Periptero
Reviews.Content: Halloween at the W in Montreal was fantastic. The hotel is located in beautiful old Montreal, walking distance from some of the finest architecture in Canada. It's location is also walking distance from downtown, and a quick cab to St. Laurent and St. Denis. Our room was amazing. Two floors with the second over hanging the first. Two storey floor to ceiling windows, and a fantastic glass shower over the living area, enjoying the view of Victoria Square. The staff at the W were fantastic! A big Thank You to our concierge Patrick for hooking us up with fantastic Canadians tickets to see them play Toronto. Two bars and a great resto in the hotel gives you plenty of reason just to stay in the hotel only. Great Hotel, great location, great staff, great city!! Andrew, Winnipeg, MB

Reviews.Title: “This hotel does it all and with so much class!”
Reviews.Author: audCalifornia
Reviews.Content: The W Montreal is the perfect place to take care of business and then relax and enjoy all this fine hotel has to offer. The warm and wonderful way the bell staff greets you and the way the front desk checks you in makes you feel so very welcome. There is also a certain "magic" in the air in every part of the hotel. The rooms are beautifully appointed and oh so comfortable. The professionally trained staff is always ready to tend to anything you might need and with such grace and style. There is nothing like a great restaurant with outstanding cuisne and an amazing wine list to go with it and how wonderful that Otto is located within the W. When you need to relax, the Away Spa has the staff to expertly pamper you. When you want great drinks and a cool atmosphere, the Plateau Bar does it well and with such class. I highly recommend this hotel for both business and pleasure!

Reviews.Title: “The Source of all Fabulousness”
Reviews.Author: flynnzo
Reviews.Content: I had never stayed in a W before, so please understand that I can only compare it to other hotels when I say: wow. It was an amazing experience. We stopped by planning to extend our stay in Montreal by one extra night. It was a Wednesday around 11:00 a.m., and Pauline at the front desk was not just helpful, she was exceptionally helpful. We needed a room to check into right then, because otherwise we would have had to leave our bags at the desk or in the car as we grabbed a late breakfast/early lunch, and she found us a room right there on the spot. And her chatting with us about why we were in town - my birthday - was really sweet, and it was even sweeter when she set a small tray of chocolate covered strawberries up to the room with a "Happy Birthday" card as well. And the room. I think that in an ideal world I will someday have that room as my oasis / bedroom. The bed was crazy comfy, the layout and styling was beautiful, and the bathroom was really neat. There were big curtains that shut the bedroom off from the bathroom, and a second curtain in the vertical rain shower. The toilet was a separate small room in the back, and it was the only weird thing about the room, as it was all dark brown with little light and a blown up photo of a dandelion head on one wall. It gets points for style but was a little less comfy-luxury and a little more artsy club bathroom stall. We tried two of the bars while we were there, the ultraloungey Wonderbar and the Plateau Bar. The Plateau was nice, but they were out of Wild Turkey and tried to substitute Jameson, something that upset my scotch-loving fiancee a bit. "You can't just take bourbon and replace it with whiskey; they're entirely different drinks, you see," he said to our waitress. She didn't quite seem to get it, but was very polite. I had an amazing Brazilian liquor drink the name of which I forget, but it had that refreshing and intoxicating quality that you only get with a great blend of liquor, lime, and mint. Highly recommend it, if you can figure out what it is from this slightly generic description. We hit Wonderbar later in the night, and it filled up like crazy and was exactly what you'd want an ultralounge to be - loud and packed full of fabulous people. It was neat to be able to bypass the line and pop right in there because we were guests of the hotel. I can only imagine how awesomely privileged you feel when you do this on a Saturday and not a weeknight. The W's location right on the border of old Montreal is choice. The concierges were very helpful when we needed a point in the right direction for food. We didn't even give them very much help the first time, when we stopped by and asked for a dinner recommendation. "What type of cuisine are you looking for," he asked. "Not steak," I said. My fiancee asked where he liked to eat dinner, and he immediately recommended Barroco, about six blocks away. We chose to walk, as we'd done a bit of driving already, and had an amazing meal. (If you go, get the short ribs. Holy moly, they fell right off the bone.) And their quick breakfast recommendation the next morning was great as well. The valets were all very nice and quite fast, and offered to wash our car when we arrived. We declined, as we had gotten it dirty on purpose offroading in Vermont, and thought the mud looked great over the bright yellow Jeep Wrangler. As we were leaving to drive back home, the valet that day gave us a few bottles of water for the road, and thanked us for staying. All in all, everyone we spoke to at the W was helpful, nice, and fun, and we had an amazing time. I highly recommend checking it out if you ever get the chance to stay in Montreal.

Reviews.Title: “My favorite W Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: burnsy0118
Reviews.Content: It was six months ago that I stayed at W Montreal for the first time and I've become a huge fan of the hotel! I'm a young professional and I like the sexy vibe from W Montreal. I've stayed at several W Hotels and W Montreal is always on the top of my list. The staffs are always nice and helpful, rooms are beautiful and clean, great restaurant OTTO, and excellent treatments at the Away Spa (you have to try the hot stone massage!). I find myself wanting to go back to Montreal just to stay at the hotel! A recommendation, sign up a Starwood account because you would want to become a loyal guest and receive top notch service. Thanks W Montreal for always making my trips enjoyable!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent as always!”
Reviews.Author: lifeisanapple
Reviews.Content: W Montreal is the first W I ever went to about a year and a half ago and it has addicted me to the brand since! The staff at the W are incredible and have always gone over the top to make sure we are happy! And do not hesitate to use the whatever/whenever service - they got some pretty difficult requests handled for us!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: flagpole_32
Reviews.Content: We had a pleasant stay at the W Montreal. I'll summarize below: Staff: The staff were friendly, but not amazingly friendly. No acknowledgement made by staff when you walked by them in the lobby; that was a little disappointing. We were celebrating our 5th anniversary and they'd sent up a little tray of chocolates, so we really appreciated that. Otherwise, no one was rude. Rooms: We were in an accessible room (not-needed?) on the ninth floor. It was a corner room, so there was extra space which we liked. The room was by the staff stairwell or something, because we heard a loud door opening and closing a lot. That was very annoying. Other than that the room was nice. Big king size bed, nice flat screen tv, and a modern bathroom. Because we were in an accessible room, it didn't have the "voyeur" shower open to the bedroom like the rest of the rooms do (so if you're not up for the see through shower, ask for an accessible room, I guess). Housekeeping: Didn't run into any room attendants, but our room was "styled" nicely every morning. One morning I was in the shower when he/she came to clean the room. Instead of trying again at another time, they slipped a card under the door that asked me to dial "0" when I was ready to have my room cleaned. I thought that was a nice idea instead of them trying to guess when a better time would be. Area: The W is located just a little out of the way of "downtown", but we walked pretty much everywhere we needed to go. It's about a 10 minute walk to St. Catherine street where we did most of our shopping and eating. We didn't mind the walking at all, it was kind of nice to tour around. Amenities: The downside to this hotel was that there was no pool. We knew that when we booked, but I still found that disappointing. Also, their fitness centre is pretty small, but adequate. There are two treadmills, two ellipticals, two bikes, some weights and yoga balls. There are little TVs on each piece of cardio equipment which is nice if you find work outs boring and they even provide earphones for free incase you forget yours. Didn't go see the business centre, but I heard it was nice. No free high speed Internet, but it's free in the lobby. I think it's $20 per 24 hour period for Internet, so we just opted to go to the lobby when we needed Internet. Restaurants/Lounges: We didn't eat in any of the outlets at the W. The restaurant "Otto" looked very nice, but we decided to go out and try other places. The "Bartini" is a small bar with about 5 stools, pretty cute. We didn't go to the "Wunderbar", but it seemed to be pretty quiet on Saturday night. We didn't try the lounge upstairs, either. Transportation: Like I said, we walked pretty much everywhere. We went to La Ronde on Saturday, and to get there we took advantage of the complimentary Acura shuttle provided by the hotel. The concierge said it was normally out of the service area, but because it wasn't too busy, they drove us anyway. I thought that was pretty nice of them. They only do drop offs (no pick ups), so we had to take the metro back. It was very quick, easy, and cheap to use the metro, so I highly suggest that over cab use. The Metro station "Square Victoria" was right across the street and it's on the orange line. Not sure what else I'm forgetting, but overall, we had a nice time at the W. I'm not sure if I was expecting more, but I just wasn't blown away. I do recommed staying here, though.

Reviews.Title: “memorable!!”
Reviews.Author: mristerackson
Reviews.Content: I got married at a restauant just a couple of steps away from the w hotel so it happened to be the most convinient location for us, but upon arrival, we realized that it was much more than just convenient. Our room was by far the nicest and trendiest room I had ever seen and for a price that really matched our budget. It was spic and span and cosy. We had dinner downstairs the first night and it was delicious. I will definitly be a repeat guest at the W. It really made our wedding weekent an extra special experience!!!

Reviews.Title: “Swank Hotel- With"interesting" Showe”
Reviews.Author: bcohen4228
Reviews.Content: Overall, it is a very swank hotel with very cool bar scene that guests have immediate access too. It is a little bit on the pricey side but that is expected with most W hotels. The showers are surrounded by glass that look out onto the bedroom which is fine if you are with your spouse but if with your buddies on a bachelor party trip it is very awkward

Reviews.Title: “Wow Wow Wow Wow!!”
Reviews.Author: albert1982
Reviews.Content: Well the title of this review says it all, i was amazed from the moment i found the hotel, the valet was super helpful in giving me a couple of parking options. First impressions count, and the valet was so so helpful, very friendly and welcoming. When i got in the hotel, i was jaw-dropped at the funkyness, the music, everything about the lobby made me feel so relaxed after an uncomfortable two night stay at Le Meridien in Montreal. I eventually headed to reception, who were amazingly helpful, they were so genuine and had a sincere smile. Then to the room. This is what hotel rooms should be like. It was so so funky, the bathroom was top class, i'm one of these guests who go straight to the bathroom to check that out, i dont know why, i just am!! Unfortunately i had to check out really early for a massive drive to Halifax, so i didnt get to try the breakfast, but from talking to a fellow guest in the bar at night who stays the regularly, i missed a treat. I want to return to Canada soon, so i will certainly make sure Montreal, and the W, is on my schedule!!

Reviews.Title: “AMAZING Weekend in AMAZING hotel!”
Reviews.Author: swlogan
Reviews.Content: When deciding to spend a special weekend with my partner, I opted to go for the W Montreal, as I had stayed there once before, and continue to hear great things about it. Provided below is a breakdown of our stay, along with some honest feedback about all areas. CHECK-IN Checked in a little earlier than planned, but was welcomed by a very pleasant worker at the front desk. The lobby is pretty frunky, and has a young, hip, and "club" feel to it, complete with the red mood lighting and music. Following a conversation earlier that week with their hard working concierge Patrick, we were upgraded to a WOW suite. THE ROOM The room itself was INCREDIBLE! 20 foot ceilings with a whole wall of windows, opening up on the terrace, our two-story WOW suite was on the penthouse level of the hotel. There was a great living room and 2nd washroom on the main floor. Walking up the stairs to our loft bedroom was great, the coolest feature being the bathroom on the second floor which has a shower that opens up to the living room on the first floor! Very sexy, indeed! Bed/pillows was great and very soft! ROOM SERVICE We had an amazing worker on our floor (Penelope) who took GREAT care of us! She brought us a bottle of champagne following our arrival, and was very pleasant. She had taken care of all arrangements for setting the room up for a special reception we were having the following night, so we had absolutely nothing to worry about! She arranged to have all of our bottles put on ice, and set up the entire bar area for us. The price for the juices/soft drinks we had ordered were on the expensive side (typical of room service everywhere, though it seemed much more expensive at the W than I've seen elsewhere) but still, the convienence of having them worry about it/get it all set up is worth it! SPECIAL REQUESTS The W prides themselves by offering their whatever/whenever service, and it's totally true! When I realized that I forgot my iPhone charger and panicked when my phone was almost dead, another friendly concierge (Mireille) recharged it right at her desk. Calls to the front desk for special amenities/requests that we wanted to the room was always brought to us promptly by yet another hard working/attractive staff member. The concierge also recommended a great place to eat, and arranged our reservations in record time! WUNDERBAR A few years ago, the Wunderbar at the W was the place to be. It still is. We ended up here after a few other clubs and it was a good time. Good music, beautiful people... good times all around!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for one, not so great for us.”
Reviews.Author: Yahooer
Reviews.Content: W Montreal is a great, stylish hotel in a wonderful location. This was our first W and we were surprised to find the wall between the bathroom and the bedroom is made of glass. They call it an open concept. It means you can see out into the bedroom. And anyone in the bedroom can see into the bathroom. All the bathroom. In our case, not necessarily a pretty sight.
